product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: McGannskiRules
content:
This is the "apple" of digital thermostats and it's made by google (Nest's parent company).

It looks great on the wall. Has a solid feel to it and comes across as very well crafted. It would've been nice to have been able to compare out old thermostat to this one to see exactly how much we're saving on our oil bill but we're definitely going through less oil than we used to.

Installation was a breeze. I actually opened a chat with one of their reps to ask them a quick question about the unit and they pretty much insisted that they would stay connected with me until I completed the setup and tested everything out.

The configuration is a breeze too - at least it was for our heat-only system. 

The major shortcoming is the software. There are some things that are just not intuitive like the eco settings and some things that just leave you scratching your head wondering what they were thinking when they wrote the code, like displaying what the target temp is more prominently than the current temp - there's a feature called farsight that will show you the current temp for a moment but then it goes back to the normal display.

The usage history is capped to ten days. Seriously. Like how much memory would it take to give us a month or even a year, it's just some raw data that shouldn't take up much space at all on the device.

The home/away feature works when it wants to. There have been times I've been like, "why is it freezing in here?" and opened the app to find the nest thinks I'm away from home and times when I've been out for hours and opened the app just for the heck of it to see if the furnace is running and it thinks I'm home and the heat's cranking. 

We've had two of these installed for a little over a month and it still hasn't learned our schedule. It might have something to do with not knowing whether we're home or away, lollll, but either of these features should be pretty easy to make work any number of ways and have them work well but they just don't.

The app and web interface are nicely laid out and easy to use for the most part and from my experience with them, they seem to give you access to most of the controls and features that you'd have using the wheel on the thermostat itself, without having to stand there and scroll through everything with the notable exception of the farsight setting.

From what I can tell, you can't link two nests in different zones and get them to act smarter together, for instance to say hey the furnace is running for zone two, why not heat up zone one for a little bit too while you're at it. Maybe I'm missing something and by all means tell me if I am, but that seems like it'd be a nice feature to have.

It just feels really limited with what you can do with it and they've been out now for long enough where you think they'd have this thing feature packed with the ability to customize it a little more than what you get out of the box with this 3rd gen model.

I feel like the ecobee is probably a more robust option but just barely. That being said we did get two of these and I'm pretty happy with them ..... I'm just not satisfied if that makes sense. There's just a lot more I'd like to see these things be able to do that hopefully will be added via firmware or software updates as more people install them and clamor for more features.
title: Nice hardware. Software is lacking.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Cfig
content: Everything on the Nest from the install to the scheduling is easy to do and most of the features are pretty nice. There are two issues I have with the Nest. The first is you can't change the frequency in which the fan cycles on. It only gives you the option to come on every hour. You can select run time for 15,30,45 minutes up to 1 hour but that's it. It would be nice to be able to select every 1,2,3, or 4 hours just so the fan isn't coming on all the time. I'm sure this can be fixed with a software update. The second issue and this is a big problem is that the current room temperature is inaccurate. The Nest reads 2-3°F above actual room temp. I am currently on my 3rd Nest (Generation 3) in a 20 day period. The 1st read 75°F for over 24 hours even though there was no way it was 75° so I exchanged it. I installed the 2nd Nest and after having it for a day I noticed that it felt a little chilly in my house. I looked at the screen and it read 71° but it seemed cooler. So I put two of my previous thermostats (a Honeywell VisionPRO 8000, and a Comcast digital) and a digital food thermometer next to the Nest to compare the readings and all 3 read 68°F. (I'm no pro but I think if 3 thermometers read the same then I would say they are accurate) I called Nest and the technician said it can take up to 14 days to "learn" the temp so I waited to see if it would correctly calibrate. It didn't, and I exchanged it for my 3rd Nest hoping the other two were defective. It's been 2 days and no luck. This one is reading 2-3°F high as well. The tech also told me that the Nest's are programmed to have a 2° range. I understand this when heating and cooling so you're furnace or A/C isn't tuning on and off every 5 minutes however there should be no range on the accuracy of the actual room temp. It's either accurate or it's not. I'll give this a few more days and call Nest and see if they have a software update to accurately calibrate it. They say this has 12 sensors. How is it that 12 sensors are less accurate then a cheap $50 thermostat with 1? I don't understand.. I've included some pictures showing the temp differences. My Nest reads "current temp" 71°F and the other 3 thermometers read current room temp as 68°F. That is unacceptable.
title: Temperature not accurate.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: cherry3700
content:
Bought the Nest Thermostat hoping to save some money on our energy bill. Installation was the easiest thing possible, anyone can figure it out (just make sure you have the proper power switch turned off and check the wires for activity) When we first installed it, I actually thought I installed it incorrectly because the data being collected was telling me my AC unit was running for a good 14-15hrs straight daily!!...called my heating and cooling guy to make sure A) I installed it right and B) that my AC unit was functioning properly. when he checked my AC unit it was low on refrigerant. He topped that off and BAM my data (on Eco mode) shows my unit MAYBE runs 45m to an hour a day and even at times no usage at all for days!!!. I LOVE LOVE having a visual aid to my furnace/AC usage!!! Now we will just have to wait and see what the winter will bring...

This product was pretty pricey and I even considered getting my money back before installing it because of it's cost. BUT, reading reviews and seeing how this thermostat could save me so much more money in the long run I decided to give it a try and I am so glad I did!

I would highly recommend this product!!!
title: Love My Nest!!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: jsweaz
content:
The Nest Thermostat takes some time to get used to. Not because it is complicated to setup or program, but because it is too simple! I was used to the old programmable thermostats that turned on and off precisely at a specific time whether someone was home or not. The Nest doesn't do that. It builds it's own schedule based on your real-world use and then deviates from that schedule when no one is home.

I love how the Nest thermostat communicates with the Nest Protect Smoke Detectors, utilizing them as motion sensors to determine if someone is home or not. It also provides peace of mind that if Carbon Monoxide is detected in the home that the furnace will be shut off in case it is the source.
title: I'm a Control Freak!

content:

The most tedious part is the wifi password since there is no keyboard and typing a long complex password with a turning hub is a pain. After that I just added it to my nest account and works like a charm.

Things I like is that I can monitor usage, see usage history, set it to learn the most common temperatures. That I can see the temperature from my phone if needed and I can change it from anywhere. I can monitor temperature if I go on vacation.

Things that I do not like is the price. I got my on sale for thanksgiving but I will have a hard time buying it at a regular price.

so price aside. I love it.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: JohnDoe
content:
Sometimes developers are out of touch with reality and live in a closet.  This is a great Thermostat with some great features and one annoying flaw.  There have been 3 generations and countless software updates, but for some reason they refuse to add a real temperature Hold feature.  The only way to "Hold" the temperature if you set up you own schedule is delete your manual schedule. The auto feature is good if you have a routine but if your schedule varies from week to week,  or month to month the manual setup is better.  If I have people over and they are going in and out of the house I want to set the A/C at a higher setting so my A/C is not constantly running.  If you set a new temp it will change at the next scheduled temperature time. 

The room sensors are also great however you can not adjust the time windows for morning , midday, and Night.

 I've owned this product (1st and 2nd Gen) for 7 years the Purchase date is the most recent purchase the 3rd gen which incorporates the Sensors.
title: Good but No Hold feature

Best part is being able to control temp in the house when I'm not there, I like the "away" feature, I don't use it but I can see how it is very nice addition to apps feature, saving money by not heating/cooling house when you're not there.

Awesome little device!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Bucko
content: This thermostat replaces a ten year old product that was cumbersome to program and not particularly flexible in its settings. I like that it uses cell phones to determine if you are gone and adjusts heating temp for an unoccupied home. It can be controlled from the app and shows you the status of heating or cooling wherever you are. If you have been away for days and the house has gotten cold you can begin heating remotely so you return to a warm house. Of course it works for cooling too, providing the same energy saving benefit.

It can tell when you left the house to change the temperature to save energy when you aren't home and even start heating or cooling the house in anticipation of your return home.

Before you purchase a Nest, you need to verify if you can install one for your system.  Not every system will work.  

There are a lot of features and functionality but it is definitely on the high end of the automated and wifi connected thermostats.

author: Eni1985
content:
The Nest thermostat is definitively a must if you want to keep track of cost, adjust temperature remotely and keep comfy on all spaces. The fully take advantage of the thermostat, I do recommend adding nest temp sensors to be able to identify zones in the house that are at different temps from where the main thermostat is located. With these two options combined, you can control the times and zones of the house where the AC or heating needs more flow and would help control them accurate.

The four stars is due to the fact that it has preset times (morning, afternoon, evening and night) and it does not allow the user to change the start or end times of each preset. Not a big deal once you learn how to change other settings, but would be nice to be able to change them to avoid having to look for workarounds.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: OverlordSpock
content:
Look, let's just cut to the chase: the Nest thermostat is not the BEST smart thermostat on the market, but it is a really good one and it is the best looking one on the market. Honestly, as long a smart thermostat is pretty good at what it does, I want it to look attractive, what with being a wall-wart and all. If it's going to be there hanging on my wall, it needs to look good as well as function well. The Nest does that.

It has most of the standard smart-thermostat stuff: You can set up a programmed schedule of when you want the temperature to change; it is easy to manually change the temperature through the innovative spinning case; it pays attention to your manual adjustments and will learn and adjust your scheduled program based on what you actually do; it tries to tell when you're not at home and reduce energy usage at those times; the Nest app allows you to access and adjust your Nest thermostat remotely on your phone.

If that were it, I'd give it five stars and call it excellent. But, there are a few minor quibbles that prevent me from doing that.

Quibble 1: The Nest thermostat doesn't integrate with Apple's HomeKit (I have no idea about other smart-stuff systems). I've heard rumors that Nest is working on adding HomeKit support, but seeing as how Nest is owned by Google, I'm not going to hold my breath for this.

Quibble 2: The function that can tell if you're home or not isn't perfect. The thermostat is in a fixed location. It can only monitor the immediate area around the thermostat. If you aren't in the room in your house or business with the Nest thermostat, it may not think you are home, even though you are, and switch into away mode. I wish that Nest had some sort of remote sensor product that could be connected to the Thermostat that could be placed in other strategic locations in the home to handle this (and potentially read temperatures in other locations as well).

3. Nest is owned by Google and all the data-collection concerns that may come with that. Take that for what it's worth and make your own decision if that is important to you or not (for me, it's not—I don't care if Google knows when my thermostat changes temperature—but for others this may be a concern).

Don't take this review the wrong way. I really like the Nest. It's good. It hits most of the expectations I have of a smart thermostat. I just wish it could be great.
title: A Good Smart Thermostat with a few Minor Quibbles

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White

It came with all necessary tools, a face plate to cover marks left by old thermostat so no need for wall or paint repair, and a built in level. All set up in maybe 30 minutes. I can view my energy usage from the day before and adjustment my cooling/schedule accordingly all on my phone. I also like being able to set a fan schedule to promote air circulation even when it's not actively cooling. Be sure to check with your energy companies for rebates; in the end I got mine for less than half price.
title: I can see the savings.

It’s much more responsive to passing by or waking up to it than the gen 2. I purchased a different backplate from amazon to be a little different than the standard square plate it comes with and it looks great!

Highly recommended.

My favorite part of the thermostat is when I pass close to it, the analog clock shows up. I don't have A/C and don't turn on the heat, so I really just have an expensive, but nice looking clock. I did get this on sale, used a gift card, and received a utility rebate, so I got a good deal anyway.

author: Reggie
content: I wish I could give more than 5 stars. Easiest operation you can imagine. Maximizes fuel savings yet will warms your house quickly from wherever you may be when you need to.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: JeffHou
content: Love this product.  Works on my system without a c-wire.  Easy install and setup.  Scheduling takes a little getting used to.  Make sure you check for rebates or instant credits from your service provider!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: AlanD963
content:
The 3rd generation Nest Thermostat was easy to install and works perfectly with my heating system. It's too cold right now to check it with the air conditioning compressor.
It lights up big and bright as you walk by, and you have several choices of which display lights up. The default is just the set temperature in big bright numbers but you also have other choices such as an analog clock with a slowly sweeping second hand. Just click the face and you can see other information such as the inside humidity and the temperature outside.
A feature that I did NOT use is letting the device program itself. I turned off that feature in the setup and it was easy to select the times I wish the heat to turn up and down, as you would with a standard programmable thermostat although you can do it on the Internet as well as the device itself, and yes, everyone's favorite feature is you can turn the temp up or down from your bed, or from your car if you're on the way home.
title: I'm Happy With My Bright New Nest

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Amit
content: We have Vivint Security systems for about four years now. We were using their Thermostats before . Recently We changed it to Nest Thermostat and the results are aw some. It's worth spending a little more for this Excellent Thermostat.
title: Excellent Products from Google

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Paulmfree
content:
GREAT FOR MY HOUSE NOT FOR BUSINESS UNITS, IN MY HOUSE I HAVE 2, BUT NOT COMPATIBLE WITH MY BUSINESS A/C, AFTER 2 MONTHS SHUTS DOWN BY ITSELF, CAN RETURN IT AND GOOGLE CUSTOMER SERVICE SAID THE UNIT IS OK, SIMPLY NOT GOOD FOR COMMERCIAL UNITS.


I CANT DO A BAD REVIEW BECAUSE IN MY HOUSE THEY WOTK PERFECT, SAVE A LOT OF MONEY MONTHA MONTH.  MY BAD I DIDNT DO THE PROPER RESEARCH.
title: GREAT FOR MY HOUSE NOT FOR BUSINESS UNITS

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Jaysaballa
content: Love the nest. Recently moved into a house that has two ax units. This was an addition. The only issue I have having is that the software keeps setting me away on both units even though I am home, changed my address, and have all home/away assist features turned off. I had to turn the learning off as that was causing an issue. I’m sure just a small bug that will be resolved. Love them otherwise!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: cj23
content: This install appeared to be running smoothly until the thermostat wouldn't power on at all. That was an indication that I wasn't getting power to the RC wire. However, I had to connect the Nest to a power source for about 5 minutes to get a charge on it to see what the actual problem was. Called out an AC technician, and he told me that I should have turned off power to the furnace as well as to the outside unit. Without turning off the power to the furnace, I blew a fuse on it, causing no power to make it from there to the Nest. After he replaced the fuse, it's been smooth sailing.
title: Great product, just some tips

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: gymrat

my wife helped install.  She agreed very easy.  Directions go step by step. tell you where to put wires and easy to uninstall if you are moving.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: GonzoisONE
content: We should have purchased one of these years ago. It has a memory based on the temps you want to set it up has. We has a minor issue with the order but an online Supervisor stepped right up and corrected the problem. We will see you very soon Best Buy
title: Excellent

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: KBMarino
content: First off, the style beats the old round thermostats and the more recent square bricks mounted to the wall.  Form and function are incorporated beautifully.  Installation on my system was straightforward and simple. The only issue was the size of the wire labels. I had a hard time applying them snd getting them to stick.  Photographing the wires with tags was a great help. Once the base was attached to the wall, the first step, and the wires were attached to the screw-free clips on the base, the main “dial” of the thermostat just snaps onto the base.  Throwing the breaker back to the on position for the furnace powers up the unit on most systems. Then the setup program begins.  Simple, straightforward and done in about 3 minutes.  Connecting to the home network gives nearly immediate access to the wireless functions with Google Hone products and Alexa.  You can speak to these products or use the apps. Easy as pie.
title: Great Product

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Kiki
content: Overall I like the thermostat.  It's good for my partner who is legally blind.  He can see the numbers on the thermostat as they are large enough, and it's easy for him to use, just left or right, cooler or warmer.  Dislikes:  1)The app keeps dropping me and I have to keep signing in.  The app stays on my phone, but every time it thinks I'm out of wi-fi range, it acts like it doesn't know me and I have to sign in again.  This is really annoying if it's 3 AM and I want to turn down the air and not get out of bed.  2) The other dislike is I can't tell by looking at the thermometer OR the app what the actual temperature in the house is.  It will only tell me outside temp and the temp it is set for, but not what temp it is inside the room where the thermostat is.  It's weird.  Other than that, I like it
title: Works well

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Maddy
content: This is the third or fourth Nest we’ve bought! We installed them in our last house and now that we’ve moved into our current home, we replaced all the old honeywell thermostats with new nests. We absolutely love them and we plan to have them anywhere we live in the future.
title: Smart home is smart!!!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: cazcat
content: Had Nest since inception. Sold gen 1 to neighbor when gen 2 came out because of humidifier control. Gen 2 been working great until I had to disconnect and rerun wires from hvac to stat for a basement finish. I guess somewhere down the line I shorted out the heater diode and was forced to make an emergency run to Best Buy for a new stat. I really like the looks of the 3rd gen black. Bigger face with larger numbers is perfect for an old man. Controls are almost identical and setup was super easy. It took the info from the old stat and installed it into the new one. I didn't really have to do anything. I always recommend all the nest products to anyone who asks.
title: 3rd nest and still loving the system.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: RoboCopp
content: I had been watching this item for a long time before my purchase. When I saw the generation 2 on sale for $199, I was tempted to make the purchase, but when I read the reviews on the generation 2 I decided to go with the generation 3. The installation went well, the directions were sufficient for a novice person to understand. The only difficulty that I experienced was getting the app to work correctly. At the start, the app was unable to connect with the nest unit. Something must've gone wrong with the initial start up process, but after restarting the nest unit, the problem was corrected and I am now able to see my nest unit online.
title: I like it

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: NormanT
content: Very trustworthy brand.  I have two of these thermostats at my primary home, so I picked up another one for my vacation home.  Not only can you remotely control the temperature, but you can save money in a few different ways.  Create a schedule and if you don't know how or forget to, this smart thermostat will auto-create one for you; based on your habits or if it detects if you are home or away.  Plus, most utility companies run rebate programs (Rush Hour).  For example: to conserve energy the thermostat may auto raise or lower your temp by a few degrees once or twice months and in return, you will receive a check in the mail ($50 for each thermostat) I have received over $300 in the past few years!
title: Piece of mind and can earn you yearly refunds

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Lockman
content: This thermostat has saved me money on my utilities. It controls my house very well. If I leave my house it has my house comfortable when I return.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: wrblplayas
content: I've been wanting a smart thermostat for a few years now but my system didn't allow use of one. I found out i was able to updated the control panel on the furnace to accommodate. I was about to purchase the 2nd generation Nest when that same day they announced the 3rd generation. My friends and family all haves Nests and they are great. This 3rd generation is a big improvement. The large face, the large numbers, the farsight feature, all big improvements. $250 is a big expensive but i believe they are well worth it. Time will tell as i have numbers from the previous 2 years to compare with. Also...easy to install, easy to work. Great app.
title: First smart thermostat

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White

The Nest app is easy to use and has has had zero issues since installation. Quality is great, instructions are great, ease of use is flawless.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Kristoffer
content: I've had these installed for a little over two months now. They are an amazing product. If you don't already have one I recommend getting one. I attached my actual nil kWh used so you can see for sure. You won't be sorry.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: vcmusic
content:
This thermostat is nothing short of amazing! If you can carefully follow the instructions provided in their tutorial video, you don't even have to hire a pro to install it! That part is completely up to you, but they make it simple enough for the average person! 

Integration, functionality, and communication with the Nest app will probably make you question why you didn't purchase it sooner! Not only is it easy to setup and control, but it begins to program itself after a few days to make those same adjustments that you would likely make at certain times of the day!

I would recommend having maybe 1 other person help you during setup as you follow through the tutorial video.

If you want to control the temperature of your home from your phone, from your bedroom, your car, or anywhere, this is one of the best investments you can make in your home and save some money in the long run!
title: Flawless Thermostat!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Psychiatrymomdoc
content:
This thermostat is phenomenal! You can change the temperature from your phone so you can turn the heat down when you leave home and have it warm up when you are on your way home. 
You get a report each month about your energy use.
Creating a schedule for the house temperature on your phone is incredibly easy.
It lights up when you walk by so you know instantly what the temperature is!
title: Perfect thermostat!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Nbxfan
content:
Once this learns your pattern, which it now does based on season. You can set it and forget it. If you leave your AC on all the time, this learns your behavior and, knows when you aren't home and when to anticipate your arrival so the house is cooled before you come home. 

We turn ours off completely quite often as we like fresh air when it's cooler in the evenings and, you wouldn't think it's a big deal but, it's also nice to be able to just use the phone app to do so. Yes, it's easy enough to walk over and do but, more than often I use the phone. 

If you are looking for complaints/flaws, the only gripe I can think of is it's a little to smart. You want to make adjustments, sometimes it readjusts itself shortly after because it's on a schedule. You have to go into the app and change the schedule to avoid this. I sporadically dump the schedule regardless because things change and, I want the system to relearn.
title: No more dealing with AC

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White

author: Ztorm15

I’ve run my air conditioner more often than before, but it doesn’t run as long now, which keeps the rooms cool and the bill lower. product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: HenryD
content: I should have read more reviews. There are lots of things I like about this thermostat, although it comes up short; and I bought four for my home and am now committed! The biggest gap is that there is no HOLD TEMP feature. I had to turn off learning and delete schedules to use two of them like manual thermostats; a waste of money other than the ability to adjust from my phone. Next, I had a lot of set-up issues; multiple attempts per thermostat were required.  Finally, the AWAY feature or Geofencing has yet to work. This was very important to me. I really like the Remote Sensor functionality, although already had a problem. After running fine for several days, one sensor disconnected from its thermostat. After much troubleshooting, I found that the sensor was fine and I had to reset the connected thermostat. The learning feature is nice, but without the other features I mentioned, it’s just another thermostat. I feel I could have spent less and received equal or superior results with another brand, such as the Honeywell T9.
title: I WISH I KNEW

author: deddmowfive
content:
We have owned three homes and put a smart thermostat in each one. Nest in the first, Ecobee in the second, Nest again the in the third. Would not deviate from them again. Best algorithm for learning and monitoring. 

The integration to Google Home actually lets this down. Ecobee allows for multiple users no matter their "level." Nest creates a main app user and then add-on users. The add-on users do not have full functionality on the mobile app. E.g. - add-on users cannot take the thermostat off "away" via the app, they would need the main users to do that.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: PapaS
content:
This is my 2nd Nest 3rd Gen Smart Thermostat. 1st was installed 6 mos ago for our upstairs HVAC zone. I like it well enough to get another for our downstairs HVAC zone. Best lesson learned from 1st Nest: Don't let anyone install a Nest thermo without having a hot (power) wire connected to the Nest otherwise when the Nest's backup battery runs out the Nest will die disabling the HVAC. I had to have an licensed electrician diagnose the problem & run a hot wire to the Nest because the Nest installer did NOT know about the necessity of the hot wire because the Nest worked great once installed...for 30 days, then  while we were away from home during winter weather everything shutdown. ! I knew the system was out as monitoring it online indicated so. At anytime, I can check on the Nest using the Nest App. I can also ask Alexa for very limited information like, "what's the temperature in the upstairs mid bedroom?" The App provides much more extensive details and options, i.e. adjusting the temperature. Upstairs is empty-nested, so there's usually no one there to use it, so I haven't had any experience yet with using it's "smart" capabilities. The new one will be smart enabled so it can learn our habits via experience and make adjustment without having to make on-the-spot personal adjustments. I am anxious to see how that works out! Most significant downside: Alexa is not yet sophisticated enough to do all she's asked to do regarding the Nest thermostat...might have to wait for the development of a "Smart Alexa" to be capable of working with a "Smart Nest" thermostat!

Regarding the Nest Sensors. I love having the option of determining which of the upstairs rooms need to be comfortable for occupants. The sensors can allow that.

Smart suggestion: Check online with your area's gas/electric service provider for rebates for installing Smart Thermostats. I got a $125.00 rebate for my 1st and have application for $100.00 rebate for my 2nd.
title: Next best thing to having a 24/7 full-time butler.

author: CaptLee

My current Honeywell thermostat is powered by batteries NOT by a live wire. You take batteries out and old  thermostat goes blank. The 2nd clue was there was no breaker to kill power to thermostat. It took 2 appts with geek squad to figure this out. Bottom line, this sweet device is not compatible with all units. I'm hoping once the new AC is installed down the road, I can purchase this Nest and try again.

I will just cover the pain I have to go through to set up this. Setting this up was a nightmare, because of the wire connections, I bought this in winter and woke up every morning inside an icy cold home because the tech care support had no idea to help me on the proper wiring. After 5 days of nightmare, and complete different answers from customer care tech support each time I called,  I finally got this all set up,

The remote monitoring through the app allows us to call for heat without having to come home. There is also a report generated that tracks the amount of heat/cooling called (in hours) so it's easy to see changes week-to-week. I would never go back to a regular thermostat. I've been spoiled.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Tbeetles
content: I have now had this device for a couple of years, and actually purchased one recently for my father ( it is that simple to use once set, as he is not tech savvy at all ) The installation is relatively simple, if you follow the guides that come with the product, or you can always use youtube as their is plenty of assistance there as well if you feel intimidated by installing this without previous HVAC experience. I personally have none, and had it up and working within 15 minutes. - I won't go on about all of the features, as you can read that anywhere, what I will say is that I have seen a SIGNIFICANT reduction in my heating and cooling bill since I purchased this. First it makes changing time of day temperature scheduling a breeze, so unlike most units where you would set it and thats it forever, this is so easy you feel comfortable modifying it through out the year. Second, it learns when you are away and your schedule over time, to help turn off and on heating or cooling automatically. At first there were a few times when I would say wow it is cold in here and see that the heat had been turned off, so I would turn it back on - but after a bit it had become very accurate. Third you get a report from NEST monthly informing you of your usage and some simple breakdowns of why you saved or used more. It is a great way to get simple insight into your patterns to help adjust a bit. I literally paid for this unit within the first year. Also to boot, many power companies offer rebates to get these, as even they recognize how cost effective they are in the end!
title: Must Buy

title: Great Thermostat!

Oh, and you can control it from your phone. It knows when you leave your home and sets it for "away" to save more energy. If I had 4 thumbs it give it a 4 thumbs up.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Iseulde
content:
Before I purchased Nest, I was very apprehensive about installing it by myself. There is no way I am paying $200+ to have this item installed. However, Nest has a very good 6-minute video that walks you through how to install Nest from beginning to end. After watching that, I felt more confident, but I was still worried about drilling a hole in my wall (sheet rock). I was able to communicate with Nest representative right away - they have 24/7 service - and have my questions answered. The day I installed Nest I was able to walk through each step carefully as provided by the instruction, and when I got stuck I was able to call the Nest rep immediately. Within 45 minutes my Nest was up and running, and I have 0 handyman skills. There was very little to set up, and I really enjoyed how Nest learned my preferences after a week, and I was able to adjust it once the weather changed. I also felt my AC wasn't blasting air as violently as it was using the old thermostat, and my house is feeling more comfortable when I arrive home. I haven't had Nest long enough to see any bill changes yet, but with how much setting you can use the Nest for I think I can adjust it enough to start saving me some money. 

P.S.: Nest also works seamlessly with my Amazon Echo, and it really feels great to be ablet to control your AC by voice.
title: Easy to install, pleasant to use!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: EGMReviews
content: I had been looking for a programmable thermostat for a while. Most of them have online compatibility checkers where you can plug in your current thermostat's wiring configuration and find out if it will work for you. We just bought this house this past summer and thought the thermostat was programmable, but upon closer inspection, it wasn't. It was just made to look fancier than it really was. So I took the cover off and checked out the wiring. Every place I went said it wasn't compatible with my system. On a whim, I chatted online with the Nest customer service. The rep was amazing. She had me take some photos of my wiring and of the furnace itself. We have a funky heat pump hybrid system that doesn't seem to be supported by most programmable thermostats. Bu she said I was indeed compatible and then emailed me my custom wiring diagram for the Nest thermostat. I went to my local Best Buy and picked it up. Then, using the recommended YouTube video, I installed the whole thing myself in about 30 minutes. It worked the first time without an issue. Now I'm not the world's best handyman so I know that if I can do it, just about anyone can do it. A couple of tips for when you start using the Nest thermostat: When you first get it running, adjust it a lot. It learns from you making adjustments. If you don't, it tries to save you as much money as it can but your house might be colder or hotter than you would like. Also, get familiar with the press and turn user interface. This took a little getting used to but once I figured it out, it was fine. I am already seeing reductions in energy usage. And it is rapidly learning our family schedule. Just an all around great device that does exactly what it promises.
title: Great Product, Great Service, Great Company

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: WeekendBobVilla
content: First word: WOW! The Nest is still in learning mode so this review will mostly be about installation. I was fully expecting to patch some holes and then measure + drill new holes to mount the Nest. Nope. It comes w/ a bracket that perfectly aligned w/ the existing holes for my old thermostat (Honeywell Chromotherm III). Screwed in the bracket, matched the colored wires to the corresponding Nest tabs, inserted the wires, and then mounted the Nest. Set-up was a breeze from there - just select language, enter your wi-fi password and you're done! It took me longer to replace a wall outlet as part of this same project than it did to get the Nest up and running. Literally less than 10 minutes! As for look and feel, the Nest is a beauty. It's heavy and feels solid, not cheap. As soon as I was done installing it, I was calling all my friends and family to get one of these! Nest thought of everything, it comes with a nice plate to fit over the bracket so it looks clean when mounted AND not only did they include a screwdriver (which fit the screws perfectly), it's a magnetized driver so you don't drop the screws when installing! Genius. The Nest is the gold standard in user friendly smart appliances.
title: Installation Review

author: AZITGuy
content:
I was unable to set up my 4 wire thermostat using the online utility. I called Nest support and the support specialist was very apologetic and helpful but was unable to resolve my issue after more than an hour of effort. He finally concluded that it was bad and sent me a replacement. This time I called a Nest recommended technician to install it. He initially had the exact same problem I did. I told him it was a heat pump, so he wired it differently than the instructions and it worked. When I was ready to install the second one, I looked at what he did, combined with what I found online, and successfully installed the 5-wire thermostat myself.
After surviving that struggle I am now happy to report that they both work very nicely and I have received my rebates from the power company.
title: Pain to setup but works great

One downfall of this product that I was not happy about was the location services from your app. I was under the impression it was to start understanding if you were coming home and would heat the house up before you got there by using your location. This is not the case. It'll start heating your house when you're about a block away in my experience. Otherwise all the features they've described work just as good as they sound! I love my Nest Thermostat and would definitely recommend to others and buy another myself!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: sdaily32
content:
Super simple to install IF you have a (blue) common wire ran to your current thermostat. My home was built in 07’, current thermostat did not require a common wire but luckily one was installed just not connected so all I had to do was connect one end up in the attic to the furnace to make it “live” and then plug it into the nest.

It SAYS you can use the Nest without one but what ended up happening was my AC system would run for 30 seconds and then shut off for 10 and then kick back on. Certainly not healthy for the unit! This happens because the nest needs more power to charge its battery and my AC system didn’t take to that kindly.
title: Great product BUT you NEED a common wire

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: datmafear
content: you MUST carefully read and follow the directions VERY carefully to install this properly. You also need to know what kind of HVAC system you have and make sure you verify before purchase that your HVAC unit can have a remote controlled thermostat option installed on it and that it uses 24V AC Power! 95% of units these days do but never assume when dealing with your HVAC system as you can easily short out the controller board on your unit. Once you have done all the homework you should have no problems installing it per the directions and it works Very well on Google Home!
title: PTAC/Heat Pump unit compatible

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White

In central NC, that's not a good solution as we have days that have 40-degree swings between the daily high and low. Install of the Nest is super simple. They even provide the screw driver. Easy interface to connect to wi-fi. You can run it from the unit, on your cell phone, or over Alexa. Highly recommend

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: 2Dees
content: Very easy to install using Nest steps to connect to a/c / furnace wiring and in-home wifi. Monthly report emailed showing usage, comparisons to last month and accumulated "Green Leaf" points from economic energy use. Android app for remote access. You can set up various schedules for heat, cold or both heat-and-cold ... including a range setting that keeps temp between a high and low temp that you set, displays usage history for last 10 days with detail usage within each prior day, schedule fan-only run time up to 12 hrs., set ECO Temps when no one is home or turn ECO temps on manually any time, get reminders for filter change, and more. Overall, much more than I expected.

author: bqaggie

Installation, connection and setup was the same as before. Now looking at other smart devices for my home.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: AtomicClock
content: Replaced what seemed like an ancient thermostat with insanely complicated controls and no way to set auto cool and heat together. This Nest unit has it all: tons of settings/customization and flexibility, wi-fi to change your temps from your bed or couch because you're as lazy as I am, and it even looks cool! Installation was SUPER easy and fast, and customer service was excellent! I contacted them with a couple of pre-installation questions, and actual human beings helped me out right away! I had to make sure I was still on Earth after that call, or at least not dreaming! Anyway, just buy it, it's awesome and way better than your old one without a doubt. Just check for compatibility first, their online tool can help you with that, so that you don't buy one and then complain that it doesn't work with your system, like other people who don't do their homework. ;)

author: FrankB
content: Anyone that has a home, I recommend the Nest 3rd Gen, Learning Thermostat. It just works and if you have the other products (Cam, and Smoke Detectors) they communicate with each other, I could turn on the thermostat from my phone, from home or at work. It also knows if im home or not, so if I go away and left it on, it turns it;s self off. Great! This is an A+. SKip Geek Squad protection because Nest backs up the product and will replace it, if somethings goes wrong with it within 2 yrs.
title: Nest 3rd Gen is the best

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: TeslaNinja
content: We love our Nest. The ability to adjust the AC away from home is great, especially when the summer sets in those 120 degree temps destroy our electrical bill. The smart features are ok, but our schedule is too variable right now for this to be very helpful (when on, the nest tries to predict your schedule and adjust the temp based on what you seem to like - this only works if say every Monday in your life is uniform - ours is not with 2 young kids, variable nap times, activities, etc). You can make your own schedules if you like as well. Set up was pretty easy. I like know tech fairly well, but I am no electrician. Nevertheless, an online video or 2 and we were up and running w/o having to spent 200 bucks on an electrician. If you like, you can have the nest sense when you are coming and going (using GPS on your phone). Nest has a nice program that has our cameras, nest protect (smoke detectors) and nest thermostat all in one place. This is nice, esp when on vacation and checking in on everything. Sometimes I wonder if an Ecobee 3 would be better with its individual room temp sensing technology but overall I like the nest ecosystem so I am happy with the purchase.
title: The nest is great

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Fortyfour
content: Installed to work with hydronic baseboard heat only. Ugh! Had me worried as so many different settings to choose from and nothing specifically noting hydronic heat just “radiant” heat. It did take some time to learn (not sure if because of type of heating system) so I thought it wasn’t working initially and I kept changing the settings which didn’t help. Almost returned it. Best to set it up and forget it. I found the app a little buggy (iPhone 6s). Sometimes when away it had me logged as being “Home” so I took the “auto scheduling” off. It learns the times you prefer your heat turned up and down anyway so once I got that figured out, all was well. Didn’t have to touch it after a few days. Some learning curve but totally worth it. Customer service was also responsive and took time over phone to ensure all was set up properly. The price can be shocking but if you’re into cool gadgets and wanna change your heat setting from anywhere using an app, it’s for you.
title: I hate, like, love it

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: NewHomeOwnerinMD
content: I recently purchased a home and one of the first purchases I made was the Nest Thermostat. I loved its ease of installation Since I installed it myself. It is not only programmable, but that it knows when I’m home and when I’m not. It sets itself to ECO mode while you’re away, saving energy and my wallet! I’ve always wanted a Nest Thermostat and it has definitely lived up to my expectations!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: TT123
content: I bought two Nests, one for each floor of the house. After the installation, my power bill has dropped anywhere from $150 to $300 depending on the month. My house is fairly large, and it was built 30 years ago, heating and cooling the house is just as easy as before and SO much cheaper. In the first four months, the savings paid for the devices. They were basically free. It is also a nice touch to be able to adjust the temperature from your phone if you wake up in the middle of the night from being too hot or too cold. Also, it worked well on maintaining an economic temperature when we were on vacation. It was a comfortable temperature when we arrived home as well. I 10 out of 10 recommend this product to anyone!
title: SAVES SO MUCH MONEY

There are new monitoring options allowing for sucking humidity out of the air and eeking the most out of the recycled air in the system. We are in an older home that is quite energy efficient and this tech would be doing us much better if we were in a newer home. I definitely suggest!

author: tafwt
content: I love this device and cant wait to see how much energy I have saved this month. I know from looking at the history (the first day I let it run the same schedule as my old programmable thermostat did on a weekend when I was home). The difference in how much it ran that day compared to since then, when I can turn it up and down, with my Echo, is unbelievable. And it is so convenient in the middle of the night to be able to use my voice to turn the thermostat up or down instead of getting out of bed and going down the stairs to reach the thermostat. I love all smart devices, but this one is hands down the best. And though this is the only brand I have tried, as it is my first smart thermostat, I can't imagine any other could be any better. From the eco settings, to the history and it even tells you the humidity, and of course the ease of use through voice control.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: wildman1037
content:
If you're looking for a great thermostat with lots of functionality, look no further.

Install was easy enough. Very intuitive menu system was easy to navigate, and the thermostat was hooked up to my wifi in minutes.

After installing, just begin using. After about a week, the Nest thermostat learned all of our heating/cooling patterns and I haven't had to make an adjustment since. No setting up daily or weekday/weekend schedules!

Your nest also keeps track of how long your heat/AC runs each day and can display it to you. When you hook it to an online account, it can also provide you with monthly email reports of your energy usage.

Finally, it was super simple to get this hooked up to my Amazon Echo, so I now no longer need to walk over to the thermostat to make adjustments. The Echo can make adjustments via simple voice commands.

Highly recommended puchase!
title: Great thermostat, easy install

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: tmw1564
content: I purchased a 3rd generation Nest thermostat and installed it. I had one issue with this. To charge its batteries, the Nest needs a C (common) wire hooked up; otherwise it tries to charge itself whenever the heating or cooling system is running -- the only time current is passing through it. When I hooked one of my Nests up, it said it needed to charge its batteries, and even though my house had no need for cooling or heating, it turned my HVAC on for hours to charge its batteries. I researched, found out what the problem was, and hooked up a C wire (luckily my HVAC controller had a place to hook up a C wire and my thermostat wires each had three extra wires in them). Good luck to anyone without an extra wire to use.
title: Well Worth It

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Nick
content:
I bought this because I needed a new thermostat and wanted the cool new thing.  It works as advertised, which isn't as good as it sounded.

First of all, I would recommend getting the version that comes with the remote sensor.  I had to run out and buy it separately because my new HVAC system isn't balanced well.  Once I got the remote sensor, I was able to get everything working great!

The disappointing feature was the "learning" part.  No fault of the product, it does what was advertised, but I ended up disabling it because I wanted to manually set the schedule to do what I wanted.

What really disappoints me, are 3rd party integrations.  Nest used to work with everything, then Google demolished the API and replaced it.  Now almost nothing works with the thermostat.  I wish I hadn't bought it.  

If I could make the choice over again knowing what I know now, I would buy an Ecobee.
title: Works Well, But Lacks Integration

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Deckard3d
content: I bought the Nest because I love technology and it seemed like a great new device to try out. Within a week, it warned me that my heater was "short cycling," an issue often caused by lack of proper airflow. I am good about replacing filters, but I was buying the denser, more expensive filters. However, this was leading to diminished airflow and a doubling of my electric bill that I had just attributed to increased prices and other devices in my home. When the Nest warned me of this issue, I went out and bought the right filters, which were substantially less, and my electric bill for the month dropped by $150, cutting it in half. This little gem is fun to monitor, has great features, and will pay for itself in a month. Best purchase ever!!
title: This device saved me $150 the first month

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Tie4
content:
I have an easy setup as I only have heat, oil heater with baseboard radiators. But it works with no issues.

Super easy to setup and get up and running. Pull off your old thermostat, look at those labels where the wires are connected to, label them if necessary. Connect your new Nest and connect the wires. Setup screen is super easy and walks you through the settings.

The app is easy to use. I started with a week of learning to build out a basic schedule and then we control it with the app or have it detect when we are not home. Easy and my heat runs much less now. 

I was worried about setup, replacing a rectangle thermostat with a circle one usually leaves unfinished walls. But there is a great rectangle plate that you can install that covers that up.
title: Up and running with ease

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Dash
content: After purchasing a new home and watching our utility bills rise for a while I vowed to change all of that in 2015. I began to purchase LED light bulbs as a start, new energy efficient appliances, and then September 2015 the Nest 3rd Generation was released which caught my attention. I asked my father-in-law who had the Nest 2nd Generation for information and he had nothing negative to say about it so I was sold. After comparing it to other competitors I was hooked on this one due to the ease of installation, good reviews, and $100 electric company rebate (ask your local energy company).

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: NestLover
content: This thermostat is easy to install. The Nest website has a video you can watch that will lead you through each step. Watch the full video first. Then watch a step at a time, pause the video after the video of the step, perform the step, and repeat until installed and set up. I think someone that has never installed a thermostat can install this thermostat by watching the video (and it comes with a screw driver to facilitate installation). The video also walks you through the steps to set up the connection to your wifi network and settings. The auto away feature is very helpful in not running your unit if you are away. The internet and app set up was a breeze. I can control two units from my phone app. If you have been away for a while, you can check the temp before you head home and turn the unit on if you'd like to cool things down before you get home. There is a monitoring feature so you can see how long your unit ran each day. It is so easy to install and easy to use. product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: steve
content:
This thermostat works great and has a lot of functions ordinary ones don’t. It is also compatible with the rest of my smarthome, so I can control the AC on the go or with voice control. I have, however, encountered a few issues that prevent a 5 star review. 

First, it has not saved me any money on electricity, and I have had the product for a year now. This may be due to the fact that I already had good habits of turning my AC up when I left.

Second, Amazon Alexa can not always connect to the Nest to control. Sometimes, the “Alexa” just can’t understand me, which is not Nest’s fault, but other times it cannot find it due to connectivity problems. I am very tech savy, so this was not an installation flaw on my part.

Third, Nest automatically turns off for away mode based off lack of movement in the house. This means if I don’t go into my laundry room, it just kicks off. I have woken up in a pool of sweat a few times as a result. I really wish Nest was smart enough to sense my smartphone’s presense like some other products.

Overall, I still enjoy this product more than many I have purchased, but in 2 or 3 years, I believe there will be a significantly better product on the market that may make me wish I waited to upgrade. For now, though, this is the best thermostat I know about (though I admittedly have not looked at the ones that came out in the last year).
title: Good product but could be improved

I also enjoy the eco functionality of the next that notes when I am not home, though a couple of times I have been home I just wasn't near the nest and it stopped cooling the house. It was easy to install. I just popped off my old unit, detached the wires and installed/wired the nest using the online instructions. It was surprisingly simple and worked well immediately. I took off a star because of some of the issues with the home vs. away mode, eco mode and recently while traveling I had it on away mode so that it wouldn't cool the house so often, but for some reason on one of the days I was away it reverted back to the normal cooling schedule. At first, I thought I screwed up because my Nest shut off for a few minutes. I couldn't figure out how to turn it back on or why it turned off but eventually it came back on and it's been fine since. As far as design and features, it's exactly what it's supposed to be. It has a bunch of things you can adjust in the settings. It does the best it can at saving energy. product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: CautiousBuyer1
content:
Review for Nest Thermostat 3rd Gen Stainless Steel. 

Love this thing! Not sure if it's more about the thermostat or the fact that I don't have to get up in the middle of the night to adjust the temp as I did before. 

Now, as you may have heard in reviews as I did before purchasing, it does have some flaws. Today the Eco mode came on when my wife left for work but I was still home asleep. I knew the house felt cold for some reason. Seems if it doesn't sense movement over a certain amount of time it switches to Eco. Never really did that before today. For those that don't know, there is a mode of degree range you set for when you're not home called Eco Mode. It keeps the home from using energy when it senses that no one is there but automatically keeps the temps from becoming dangerously hot or cold.

On another note, when setting, the temp seems to sway 1 or 2 degrees from what it's set for. So if it's set to 75 it will shut off around 76, and turn on around 74. From what I've read in other reviews and forums, this is possibly to keep it from switching on and off so frequently. For these reasons I give it 4 stars.Think they may have tried to make it do too much whereas it falls short of accuracy on a few features. But for my need (which was the convenience) it is great. I can live without some of the other stuff, just switch it off. I'd say this device (as with any) is something that's according to you or your family's needs. Some features in your phone you don't use, as some other people do. Find out what you can or can't live without in your best interest. I got tired of getting up and down when I finally get comfortable. 

Either way it's better than your old thermostat that's downstairs or across the room that you have to change in the middle of the night. That alone makes it worth it to me!!
title: Love this thing!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: JV82
content: I watched the online installation video and the Nest was really easy to install. (The only thing I would alert people too, that was not in the instructions or on the online video, is that even with the breaker switched off, if any of the wires touch at all while installing (or switching out the old thermostat) you can blow a fuse in your furnace. Luckily it is a cheap and easy fix if it happens, but just a heads up to be really careful with the wires when installing to avoid the inconvenience.) Since installing the Nest, it works just as promised and “learned” my patterns within the first few days of use. The Nest and the app are easy to use. I would highly recommend it.
title: Great thermostat

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: kboyk1
content:
Do not be intimidated to install this on your own it's not hard. The instructions it comes with and YouTube online shows you how to install.
Take a picture of the way the wires were installed on your old thermostat prior to uninstalling. In doing so this will ensure that your connections are connected correctly.
It takes the Nest a couple of days to remember what temperatures you like when you are home and at what times you are home. After a couple of days Nest will ask you if you want it to automatically go into "Away Mode" when it senses you are not home.
Keep in mind the Nest system has a 1 degree band and learns your particular home. Sometimes it may seem like the Nest Thermostat's maintenance band is larger than 1ºF, but it’s most likely that your system takes a few minutes to start heating or cooling after your Nest Thermostat tells it to.
title: Nest Learning Thermostat

author: ajschenk
content:
The 3rd generation of Nest is an outstanding product. My primary reason for wanting the Nest was to meet my needs of a thermostat that I could control remotely. I travel almost every weekend, and wanted to be able to set the thermostat to a very energy efficient setting when gone for a few days, but also wanted to return the setting to my comfort zone ahead of me arriving home. This product certainly meets those needs.

The initial learning period required a bit of work, until Nest learned my patterns of when I'm home, at work, etc. After two weeks, everything was perfect.

I also have Xfinity Home Security/Automation, which this now seamlessly syncs with. When I arm the system, Nest automatically goes into the "Away" state, and restores itself to "Home" when the system is disarmed.

The install took less than 5 minutes, and comes with everything needed, down to the screwdriver. Setup to wifi and the the app took another 5 minutes, tops.

Overall, this is a great product.
title: Great product, after the "learning period"

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: ThisIsNot
content:
I followed the instructions that came with the Nest and had it installed in just a couple of minutes. Setup was a breeze as the Nest pretty much holds your hand through the process. I had it paired with my home's wi-fi and setup through the Nest app on my iPhone. I like that the Nest tries to decrease our cooling and heating bills by sensing when we are and aren't home.

My main complaint is that it wants to use temperatures that are too extreme for our dogs. The Nest wanted to let our house get up to 86 degrees in the summer and go down to 65 degrees in the winter, when we aren't home, before kicking the AC or heater on. That's too extreme for our dogs so I had to disable the energy efficiency setting for the AC. I didn't realize it was going to do this until I left to go to the store and came back after an hour to a house that was 80 degrees.

I do like being able to adjust the thermostat from my phone, the Nest is futuristic looking and stylish, and it now work with my Apple Watch. It's automatic energy savings features need to be tuned. I think it would be easier if Google/Nest just added a setting so you could tell the thermostat that you have pets. That way it doesn't get mad at me for not letting the house get above 75 degrees when we aren't there in the summer.

There are other thermostats that will work just as well as the Nest if all you want to do is control them from your phone when you're home or away. Get the Nest if you want the thermostat to learn when you're home and away so that you can shave back on your heating and cooling bills. It really has helped with the heating , not so much with the electricity for the AC.
title: Works great, could use some fine tuning

Now I don’t know about saving energy but being able to see your usage is a great feature that I use a lot and it will learn your habits. When I’m not home I usually have my system off but when I’m getting ready to head home from work I open app turn on and start cooling. When I get home it’s nice and comfortable. Yes I’m one who isn’t going to cool the house and waste energy when I’m not there. Of course winter months will be a different story. When you leave the house you can set it up to switch to eco mode which is a great feature as well. It’s a great thermostat but it is an investment but I highly recommend it. I also recommend purchasing room sensors as well if your thermostat placement isn’t in the best location.

content: We have a modest vacation home in the north Georgia mountains. While I do not want the pipes to freeze, I also do not want to pay for heating the place when we are not there. I could leave the thermostat on 50 degrees, which is what I did before I got the Nest thermostat. Now, I can monitor the weather and turn on the heat when the temps drop. When we are there, the Nest works with my Google home device, and even shows the weather forecast. When we are away, I can monitor the inside temperature, the humidity and set it where it needs to be.

Gives you a lot of information and the application for apple or android users, allows you to control and monitor your house thermostat. It is also convenient for those moments when you're really lazy and don't want to walk to your thermostat to change the temperature, you simply do it in your app. But the best part is that it learns from your habits and you can program it.. I live in miami and there is nothing better than have my NEST turn the AC on so when I arrive the temperature is nice without wasting money leaving the AC working all day. Great investment.

author: tree100
content:

I couldn't be more thrilled! And did I mention I can now turn down the AC when I land at the airport so that my house is cool when I walk in the door? BONUS!

The only con is the price. These aren't cheap. However, check with your local electrical provider that might have rebates associated with this. Mine gave a $75 rebate for connecting it to my utility account. And supposedly they will give an annual $25 credit for as long as it is connected - essentially paying for itself even if you don't account for electrical savings that this will supposedly provide "learning" our habits.

author: yashart

I got tired of reading forums online and trying to figure out what the best AC cycle schedule for my home. After a few weeks, I decided to give the Nest a try to see if the "grass was greener". Sure enough, I've been enjoying the new thermostat for a few days now. No tweaking. No reading up online. No fuss. The thing just works. I don't regret my purchase; I haven't looked back :)

author: CASF
content:
To whom it may concern:

I have a Nest device that is less than 2 years old.  When I turn the dial, it continues to say, “Please connect to base.”  Also, when turning the dial, it then falls off at times.

I am a single mother of 2 children and I ask concerned about the health and well being of my children.

Can you please escalate this appropriately?

Thank you,
Carie Finch

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Ajhh
content:
Pros:
- gives monthly reports of usage.
- It knows when you are away (motion detection) and reduces the temp automatically to save power
- easily connect to WIFI
- Control your thermostat from anywhere
- Fairly easy to install a C wire for charging.

Cons:
- cost
- works best with a C wire for charging the battery. Some setups don't have an extra wire to be used for charging.

This is the 2nd Nest Thermostat I purchased. I had to install a C wire for each Nest I installed because my setup did not have an extra wire and I live in an area that can get extremely cold in the winter. It was as simple as running a new 5 wire thermostat cable through the holes that already had my existing thermostat wiring. Then I found the C terminal on my furnace and attached the wiring to it.
title: Great thermostat for a connected world

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: rfm42
content:
Thus far I have been very happy with the Nest Thermostat, which replaced a standard 5-2 programmable thermostat. Installation was a breeze, though the smaller profile of the Nest left an exposed unpainted area that was behind the previous, larger thermostat and which needed to be repainted. 

The Nest learns your standard schedule very quickly, and it is easy to make changes on the go from either the thermostat itself or from the Nest app. I am also a big fan of the "auto away" feature that turns down the heat when you are away from the home (it detects "away" based on a combination of motion in front of the thermostat and (optional) location services on the Nest app).

I would definitely recommend upgrading the the Nest, especially if your utility company offers a rebate on the purchase of a smart thermostat.
title: 2 months in and a fan of the Nest

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: 6stringer
content:
If I had to do it all over again, I probably would have gone with the ecobee 3.

Here is my story. After purchasing the thermostat from a nearby Best Buy store, I contacted Nest tech support to verify the proper connections were made. After they asked me a few questions, they direct emailed me a diagram, and it was followed to the letter, The system appeared to be working, but had a problem getting consistent cold air - the heat was also engaging when it wasn't supposed to (the outside temps were in the 90s). I called tech support, and they said the base plate that is mounted to the wall must be faulty. I was one day outside of Best Buy's return policy, so they sent me a new base plate at no charge. I still had the same problem. I had a qualified AC tech come out to the house the tell me the diagram from Nest had the wires hooked up incorrectly. 

I was a little disappointed this was not found on initial contact through the chat support nor on the one hour follow up phone call I had to make. I also wish it had Home Kit support through my Apple products.

I would recommend to a friend, but would add a word of caution with proper connection to their system.
title: Decent thermostat, but a bit buggy out of the box

author: Dallas

Out of 10 days, 7 has been minimal... I fan wait seeing my next electric bill!!! moreover, I really enjoy not having to get out of bed to set the tempetature... I either open the app, or ask Alexa to do it. It has been a short time since installation, but I'm already in love with my Nest.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: BradleyJ
content: Although I am happy with the two nest thermostats that I purchased I was not happy with the nest website, specifically where you enter what wires your current thermostat has and it tells you if the nest will work. Basically it says the nest will work for me (what it doesn't say is that you kinda have to hack it to work) After reading about horror stories online doing it the way nest says to (for my situation) I went ahead and pulled new thermostat wire to both zones and upgraded my zone relay switch box. I only splurged for the nests because after the sale I got both for 400 then I got 200 back from my gas company as a rebate. In the end I paid 200 total for both which was awesome..... then I had to tack on about 40 for new wire and 110 for the new relay box (not to mention hiring a professional to install the box if you aren't the type of person who feels confident doing the work. I did it myself and it's pretty easy, intimidating but easy). I still saved but now it doesn't feel like such a great savings haha. There are cheaper options that do the same thing but nothing will be as cool as a nest. It's definitely a splurge item. If you plan on just buying this and installing it make sure you have at least 3 wires behind your current thermostat and one of them is a constant 24v (this is assuming you are using the thermostat for heat only, heat and ac will require more than 3 wires)
title: Cool if you're into tech but research carefully

His girlfriend purchased one for him for his birthday which he installed yesterday. He loves it! So I guess I am giving you three reviews on the Nest and each one is very happy with their Nest! Some utility companies are offering a rebate if you purchase one. This makes it an even better buy!

content:
I did a lot of research over the last couple years and decided a nest thermostat would be the one I would install once I was ready to upgrade.

I already had Honeywell products, but upon review, the nest met my needs not to mention it looked better.

Installation was a breeze. Easy step by step directions as well as the tools needed.

Set up was again easy to follow. Took a few minutes, but worth it. 

The nest works great and some how seems to be heating the house better than my old thermostat but runs the heater less. Not sure how, but I am amazed.

Only thing I wish it had was a way to communicate with my alarm to use that to set the away mode (Eco mode)

author: JDRed
content: Very simple to install and use. I went to nest.com and got a wiring diagram and watched an install video, all before I purchased the unit. It took about 15-20mins to install…with patching the wall and paint from the old t-stat about 1.5 hours. I really like having the ability to access the thermostat via my phone. The location of the t-stat in my house is in a place where auto away really won’t work. So, I have turned the auto away feature off and tweaked the schedule that the nest came up with. My power bill is norm $180-$200 this time of year and the bill after installing the nest it was $169; so far so good on reducing energy usage. It’s working as advertised. I have had no issues with the battery. I’m very happy with the purchase and would buy the unit again.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: tnseditor
content: The Nest thermostat is easy to install in most cases. I was able to install it in my house with a heat pump, gas furnace, and humidifier. When I purchased one for my brother, all went well until realizing he had two wires for his humidifier instead of one required by Nest. After talking to the helpful Nest tech support representative, it was decided to call a local HVAC company to modify the humidifier to use only one wire. Since then, things have been working well. We both find them easy to operate both in person and the app.
title: Great thermostat

This thing is super intelligent! I specifically love the fact that it can tell when my wife or I am home and adjust the temperature accordingly. It backs the AC use down while we are at work, and kicks it back on when it realizes I am near the house.
title: Great buy!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Frost
content:
I work in the tech space and it's always nice getting my hands on a new piece of tech. I had an ecobee before the Nest and while it does have remote sensors it does not have the vast support of third parties and their devices. The Nest has the "Works with Nest" network giving it many more options then any other product in the space.

I have yet to have any issues using it and have seen about a 11% saving in my cooling bills, living in Phoenix. Mainly because of the auto away feature that is nice for people who are away the majority of the day. No real setup required and the auto learning takes effect after a week, at which time you don't even have to think about it.
title: Awesome

install was simple, straight forward and easy. hard part was turning off breakers!

So far, after a week this little guy is pretty awesome. it's bright, clear and really classy. All the settings are easy to navigate. I highly recommend it!
