product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Momm
content:
I give this product one star for the first item, which was ultimately resolved by a second unit. If I could give negative stars for Nest as a company, I would give them a -10. If you keep reading, you may not want to purchase this item in the first place. **Warning: It is long, but trust me... you want to read it!**

I bought two of these for both zones in my home. One worked flawlessly and calibrated itself within minutes. The other one, however took more than an hour to calibrate, which after calling Nest Support, they claimed was normal since they verified it was wired properly. Something, however told me that it wasn't normal, but I accepted the word of the expert on the phone. Eventually it calibrated and started blowing warm air like it was supposed to since it was winter. It seemed to take a little longer than normal to reach a warm temperature and we noticed it would turn on for what seemed like no reason, but thought it just must be a super sensitive product that would keep the air temp. precisely where it should be, so we ignored that as well. As the seasons changed and we got hit with a particularly warm spell early in the Mid-Atlantic, the A/C never turned on. In fact it was still blowing warm air even though it said it was "cooling". 

I tried trouble shooting and eventually went through the entire set-up procedure again to no avail. I called Nest Support and the woman on the phone was very pleasant, but told me to disconnect a wire that the previous agent had told me was installed properly. She also told me to leave this wire disconnected since it caused the unit to begin to blow cold air as it should. Okay, I will once again accept the advice of the "expert" and do as I'm instructed even though it goes against that gut feeling that it was wrong. I was just thankful to have cold air again.

The next day I go to work and get a call from my neighbor telling me that my A/C unit is making strange loud noises. When I get home, I hear the crazy sounds coming from my unit and the upstairs is hot. Really hot! Immediately shut it off and don't bother calling Nest at this point. I get a real A/C tech over to check my system. He tells me that my Nest was sending too much voltage to the unit and fried my "contactor" which switches between hot and cold. He replaced that part, put the Nest back on line and wouldn't you know....same issue occurs. He removes the Nest, puts a different thermostat on (also a learning system) and it worked perfectly. Then to show he wasn't trying to sell me anything, he took that down and put my ORIGINAL thermostat back up and again it worked perfectly. He told me I was lucky because a few more hours of use could have completely destroyed my A/C unit, then I would be looking at several thousand dollars to replace it.

I explained all of this to Nest Support and finally they agreed to send me a replacement Nest since I still wanted to use their product. A few days later I received it, installed it and it calibrated itself in less than 10 minutes. Surprise, surprise. AND it worked right the first time. So what would you do if you had this happen to you and your gut, your technician and the experiences all pointed to Nest damaging your A/C unit? Right! You would call them and request that they pay for the replacement part. You might even demand that they pay for the labor and appointment fee as well. I didn't though. I only asked them to pay for the part! A $165 part. That's it. 

Here is where the trouble really gets stupid and frustrating. This whole thing started in April. I was put on hold, promised call backs, transferred to multiple "specialists", ignored, insulted by argumentative language and then ultimately dropped from their radar all the while thinking I was getting somewhere. Two days ago on June 22, I could take no more and called and demanded to have the issue resolved immediately. I was not going to be promised a call back or to leave a message. After being transferred and hung up on, eventually I reach another "specialist". ONE HOUR LATER.... I was told my request was denied. Then she argued with me for requesting them to take another look and gave her the WHOLE story again. She said and I quote, "Ma'am, if you want me to submit this to our senior management again, it will be denied".

Enough. I give up. The Nest was defective and damaged my unit. That is 100% clear, honest and factual and even Nest knows this because they gave me a new unit. Nest support is garbage and will NOT support you when they are at fault. Buyer beware for sure! Do yourself a favor and ask technicians first if they have any issues with them before you trust your very expensive A/C unit to this thermostat. You will be surprised. What they don't tell you is it is NOT always compatible with your unit. You will NOT know this unless you ask them. Then they will reluctantly tell you. Good luck and you have been warned!
title: Buyer Beware/Some Defective & Cust. Service Aweful

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: FCJRK
content:
So this thermostat is the first one I’ve ever installed/replaced. It was very easy to do and I labeled my wires with the provided stickers. Literally walks you through everything step by step once it’s on. There’s not much else to say about the install itself. 

This device looks very nice! Has a big/bright display, has tons of options and settings depending on your needs and temperature habits. I’m actually very impressed with the unit itself. I’m used to either older digital models or the ones filled with mercury. So this is like looking into the future. 
I have not downloaded the app because currently I still prefer manually turning the dial. Which is fun to do nonetheless. 
There are settings galore and I do think the nest would be useful to many households. It is also supposed to help save money over time, not overnight. Calculate the costs and find how many months or years it takes to pay for itself. Anything saved after that is dollars in your pocket. 

My complaint would be to add a single temperature sensor in the box, without spending the extra money on the upgraded package. It does have one built into it, but honestly how many homes have the thermostat in an odd spot? In an area that isn’t used often or doesn’t get enough airflow for accurate temps?

Other than that I’m very happy with my nest purchase, it looks sleek and offers many settings for every temperature need I’ll ever have. 
Have a bright future and smart home!
title: Great thermostat/Wish it had spare sensor included

author: Strucen
content: The Nest Learning Thermostat 3rd Generation Brass model is beautiful and delightful to use. I reviewed the pro's and con's (not many con’s) thoroughly and when thermostat went on sale and combined with the local utility rebate I purchased it. It has pretty much lived up to all the pro's and more. The thermostat was easy to install and if you do your research - watch a bunch of YouTube video's and follow the directions - it works. Wi-Fi functions perfectly. Never had a problem since I installed it. I also purchased 3 sensors to give me a total view and control of temperature throughout the house. It connects to the Google Assistant where I am able to check and set the temperature of the main thermostat. Awesome! I have been monitoring the history of the heating unit (purchased in colder season so haven't used for cooling yet) which I was unable to do with the traditional programmable thermostat I had previously and it’s great to see and be able to make decisions on heating the house based on this knowledge. I have started to program the heating activity throughout the daily and weekly schedule but haven’t even scratched the service of this powerful tool. All-in-all we are very pleased and would purchase again. It really has revolutionized the way we monitor and control the temperature of the house which in the long run has to save on energy consumption! But in the end it’s all about feeling comfortable in our home and this thermostat has given us greater control over that!
title: Beautiful Thermostat and Easy to Setup & Use

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: JUMA
content:
I was a little skeptic to pay $250 for a programmable thermostat and even when the price dropped when the 2nd Gen came out, I was still skeptical. But I have a family that includes 3 small children so our schedules are hectic and we don't always remember to turn our thermostat down when we should. Plus we go to the lake a lot in the summer and being able to control the thermostat from our smart phones was very intriguing to me. So I went ahead and made the purchase and after about a week, its been great. Its learning our schedule and the "Auto Away" has kicked in when we have left for an extended period of time. In fact with that feature, we only need to turn it up/down from our phones now when we are coming home from an extended leave. I will be anxious to check our electricity bills from last year to see if am getting the savings that I believe I am. Its a truly "set it and forget it" type of deal.

Now, I did have some problems with the installation. I am not expert in the HVAC business but I feel I do a pretty good job of following instructions. I did as I was instructed (configuring the wires) and the heat wouldn't kick on. I called the Nest customer service and we ran through a bunch of tests and after about an hour and half we came to the conclusion that I had system with a water pump and thermostat needed to be configured with the update. The problem was, my nest wouldn't update when connected to my computer so we had to wait for the "OTA" update. Finally it connected to my WiFi and updated and the customer service rep helped me reconfigure my wires so that the Nest worked with my system. Its worked like a champ ever since. The customer service rep was nice and patient and that ordeal was the only negative about buying the Nest but not sure it was anyone's fault, really.

Overall, I would recommend the Nest especially if you are a busy family running throughout the week. It seems to be able to save you energy (and money!) even when you aren't paying attention to it. Is it worth the money...maybe. It all depends if you are disciplined enough to set your "dumb" programmable thermostat every time. If you do that, than its not worth the money. If you are like me though, I think its going to be a good investment.

I will try to update my energy and money savings as I go along. That might help someone to decide to purchase or not if they know the actual savings this thing might give them.
title: Excellent thermostast

author: Bestbuybaby
content: We finally purchased the Nest thermostat 3rd generation after watching and hoping prices would drop. We absolutely love the Nest! It learns when I drop the temperature before bed and raise it up in the morning and does it for us. I highly recommend this device.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Julie
content:
Easy to install. They give you very straightforward directions so you can install it yourself. I've never messed with a thermostat before and installed it myself in about 20 minutes. 

Features are obviously great, too. You can set an "eco" range for when you're out of the house. It will allow the temperature to drop to the minimum you set or rise to the maximum you set so that the air/heat isn't running constantly. It will then use the motion sensor and/or the location of your phone to know when to turn the air back on. Only thing I would add would be the ability to start heating or cooling the house before you get home, but it seems to only start once your phone reaches your house.
title: Stylish and packed with features

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: jtorres254
content:
My experience with google products has been a positive one for the most part. This thermostat continues to not disappoint. Setup and instructions are super easy. 

Our electric company here in San Antonio gave us an $85 credit plus another $30 annually to participate in Rush Hour events; these are merely high usage times where you agree to let the power company and the Nest change your thermostat setting a few degrees a few times a week to help ease strain on the grid. 

Integration with my Philips Hue gen 1 bridge, MyQ garage door opener and Amazon echo is great. Being able to remotely control and shut the system on/off is fantastic. 

It IS a bit pricey, but there is so much technology in this little device that will actually save you some money on top of the elec company's incentives that it will pay for itself very quickly, compared to other green tech that takes years to recoup.
title: It's worth it. Ditch your old analog one.

author: afern
content:
This thermostat has almost paid for itself by saving me money on my heating/electrical bills. My AC doesn’t run as much during summer and my heating doesn’t run as much in the winter. Also, when I leave the house, it auto adjusts the temperature to a range that won’t use as much energy. Lastly, it has intelligent scheduling so it learns when you want it warmer/cooler on average during the day.

This product was very easy to install by myself using the included instructions, tools, and wire labels. However, if you’re concerned with electrical work, just contact your HVAC company. I’ll never go back to a “dumb” thermostat!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Craiken
content:
Easy to install, if you use Google's compatibility test first on their website. If it says it's good, then installing it is as simple as following the app. I've started constantly checking the temperature and found the temperatures spike throughout the place at various time, helped me narrow down lack of insulation in the attic by room.

I recommend buying several of the thermostat puck things to place around the house. Just so you can use the Nest app to check those room's temp and turn on the air/heat for where you are, not the hallway your thermostat is likely to be.
title: Easy to install

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Technomom
content: I'm not a person who usually takes the time to review products even though I depend on the reviews to buy my items. I'm sort of ashamed to admit that. That being said, I felt that I must review this product. I have installed at least five thermostats previously in varying places and this was by far the easiest. Not only was there a place to go online to ensure the compatibility of my system but there were numerous videos and instructions to follow should I need them. I didn't need anything but the instructions packaged in the box. A smooth setup followed by immediate connection to my wireless and app on iPhone. I've been using it over a month now and I know it has saved me energy already. I am waiting for the next electric bill to truly show usage as I just bought my house. I no longer forget to turn my thermostat up or down when I leave because I now have Nest...and it has learned my habits already. It has a ton of settings but it walks you through it all step by step and it is compatible with security cameras and other things if needed. Highly recommend!
title: Easiest thermostat ever to install and use!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: mlbk
content: This thing is awesome. We've had it for 2 yrs now and it's been super helpful. No problems with it at all. We have actually seen a reduction in our electric bills and I think it's largely due to this being installed. It's so convenient to be able to program different temps at different times of the day. Sure, we want our pets to be comfy, but they don't need it nice and chilly on hot days the way we like it when we're home! And we can adjust from our phones from anywhere, so lying in bed at night, want to bump it up or down a few degrees, just grab your phone instead of going downstairs to adjust the thermostat. It tracks your patterns and preferences and makes its own adjustments to try to fit into your lifestyle as well. Works seamlessly with the Google Home, so even if we're too lazy to pick up our phones to adjust it, we can just ask Google to do it for us! It also reminds us when the filters need to be replaced, and has a bunch of other features as well. We probably aren't even using it to its full potential but we do a lot with it and it's definitely one of those things that you wonder how you used to live without it.
title: every home needs this

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: MGM374
content:
Hands down the best thermostat I've used. We've had it for a little more than a month and it does change the way the house is cooled and controlled.
Most thermostats I've used are very old with bare minimum features or just weird controls overall. The Nest is straightforward, sleek, and it feels like a solid device in the way it's constructed with a solid weight to it. The app makes it very easy to use and the ability to change the temperature without having to get up is game-changing.
The Nest also learns what temp you like it and when. It starts to schedule itself based on your temp changes. Within about 2-3 weeks a schedule started setting and we only had to make 2 tweeks to the 'learned' schedule, otherwise it was spot on. Now we don't really think about the temp in the house. Would absolutely put it in the next house that doesn't have one.
title: Couldn't go back to an old thermostat

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Careheart
content:
The "smarthome" may sound like an unnecessary luxury, but certain home utility functions really do improve one's life. Automated thermostat is one of them!

No more forgetting to turn off the heat or A/C when you rush out the house. No more getting up for frequent adjustments when the home is slightly cold or hot. No more stairs to groan about when your tucked warmly into bed. No more multiple unsightly thermostats. We are living the dream!

Favorite features:
- Away mode tracks when nobody is home and defaults to away settings
- Ability to adjust temps remotely on extreme temperature days for pets
- Monthly usage data report
- Set schedules and change schedules whenever I want

Issues:
- Occasionally has very odd "learned" temp adjustments. Nest has created schedules with really high or low set temperatures. Not sure what caused this but it went away after we deleted it via the app. This has happened more than once
- Historical lookback only goes 1 wk on the app

I must also mention Nest has been fantastic. Almost a year in I noticed a chip on the glass face and they immediately sent a replacement. Love companies that stand behind their product. Builds a ton of loyalty!
title: No more running downstairs to adjust the heat!

I can honestly say without a doubt that this product is worth every dime it costed. Setting up was easy as well as downloading the app. It doesn't get any easier, you can go through the programming process or just let Nest do it's thing by learning your routine. Either way you can't go wrong.

author: Nuyorican
content: The Nest Thermostat is definitely the best thermostat I ever owned. This thermostat is best used if have a smart home or making a smart home. I use Google Assistant to control the Nest as well as the Nest App. A wifi connection is strongly recommended to get the most out of this product because that is where it starts saving you energy costs. It can use your phones location to know when you are not home and put itself in Eco mode or you can set a schedule. This can be on a 2.4GHz or 5GHz connection. Installation was easy and I have no experience changing a thermostat.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Marinepilot
content:
This thermostat is everything it is cracked up to be and more! It has lowered my energy bill another $50 at least since I've gotten it. The ability to program it when you are there or away, and then it enhances that program by learning your habits is amazing. It thinks of things that I don't even think of! The one thing that would be better if built right in would be the ability to geofence the Nest, but there are third party apps out there that let you do that, so you can set it and forget it basically. When you leave the house it goes into away mode, and you have it turn itself back on and start cooling/heating when you are on your way home! The ability to heat and cool is extremely well liked also, so during those odd times of the year when one day you have heat on in the morning and air on in the afternoon, you can use that setting so you don't have to keep running back and forth to the thermostat. I also love that I can control it from my phone or tablet. Too cold in the morning? Grab the device and turn the heat up without getting uncovered!

I love my Nest thermostat and am looking forward to purchasing a few Nest smoke/CO2 detectors in the near future! Very highly recommended!
title: Just incredible!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: javaguy
content: This product is great, as it helps to reduce unnecessary utilization of HVAC. It's ability to automatically set a schedule based upon your being home or away is one of the most useful features. Only issue occurred during installation, as the thermostat states that it does not require a "common" (C) wire for power. That is incorrect, as the thermostat does not function properly without one. If a C wire is not used for power, then the thermostat will obtain a charge by sending a pulse to your HVAC unit every minute or so...in my case, this caused my A/C to turn off every minute. I'd say if you can run a C wire or if you have one available, that is the recommended way to install.
title: Works well, elegant interface, and saves money.

author: le12
content:
Extremely user friendly and easy to install. Nest package comes with back plate, screws, and even screw driver and built in leveler. I was not sure if the Nest would be compatible with my unit, so I called the company directly. They were great. I sent them a picture of my unit and wires, and within 2 minutes they sent me back a personalized wire configuration map. They even sent a follow up email to make sure I was able to install correctly. 
I have only been using for a few weeks, but I am already starting to save money and energy! I will be buying a second Nest soon for my upstairs unit.
title: Nest Easy to Install

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: BigD
content: Bought this since my children each have one. Replaced an older programmable (not connected) thermostat. If you want to protect your privacy by restricting location, you must manually set the "home" and "away". This thermostat "learns" by looking for patterns in your home-away designation. It also has recommendations for energy efficiency. If you have regular patterns, this will effectively adjust your temps. There have been minor reports regarding loss of memory and function, however these seem to have been addressed through firmware updates. The controls are problematic if your Internet connection is dicey. Thus a strong wired primary with a wireless repeat connectivity is a must. Thermostat can be controlled manually at the wall in the event of loss of Internet, but remote operation is absolutely reliant of connectivity. This is a problem with all IoT. This can be wired to furnace/AC via a four or a five wire connection. Some thermostats require a five wire connection and many existing furnace hook-ups do not have them. Check the wires before purchase. Spent more time spackling/painting wall than installing since even with optional faceplate there was still uncovered surface. Installation w/o faceplate a more modern, pleasing look. Recognizes when you are in motion, so if themo is installed in an area where humans do not roam...
title: Easily programmable, but must be constantly online

My favorite part though is I can control my house thermostat while I’m on vacation or anywhere because of the app. Overall, I love this device.

My family the loves having the app on their devices. So we rarely touch the thermostat.  We love the fact that we do not have to adjust it when leaving or returning. It  does this automatically  and our electric bill has gone down since installing this thermostat. My thermostat in my second place went out and I replaced with another Nest Learning Thermostat.

It literally took me 10 minutes to install and about 10 minutes to go through the setup of the thermostat. It will take sometime for the thermostat to learn hence a learning thermostat. All in all I am confident in my purchase and that over time it will pay for itself and help save me some money. The nest app for your phone is very basic and simple to use. In the app you can select you're temps, eco mode, turn up/down temps and more. I gave it 4 stars only because I have had it for a short time.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: thedustmonkey
content: Simply said, an impulse buy that I knew could be returned, however, it was installed within 15 minutes, programmed with its basic features understood in another 15, and left on its own from there. While it requires a bit of user input the first week -- most of it done from a simple and quite usable app available for both iPhone and Android smartphones -- after that, only minor adjustments will be done from time to time to alter what might be considered the household's usual schedule. It allows an unprecedented degree of control, from close or afar, of one's temp settings. Crank the heat up 30 minutes before hopping out of bed on a brisk morning, or have it activate the fan for a preset time period in the middle of the night with the same ease without getting up and fumbling around with the blasted thing in the dark. It provides an accurate record for each day, indicating when the heat or a/c was activated, whether by the thermostat or a household member, to what degree, and for how long it was on. There is simply no way this can't ultimately pay for itself after the rebates and ultimate savings on the heat and cooling bills. Highly recommendable, and one of the few products that I would really have to scratch around to find something to call a shortcoming.
title: Extraordinary device -- no regrets.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Phil123
content:
During my routine furnace maintenance this fall, I asked the serviceman about installing a smart thermostat. He said that it would cost me about $125 if they did it, but he removed the cover of my previous thermostat and labeled all the wires for me so that I could install the Nest myself. This was very helpful, because not every system used exactly the same colors and codes. Installation was very easy except for one wire I wasn't 100% sure about, so I called Nest support and spoke with a technician. He checked the information about my existing thermostat and was able to clarify the confusion for me. I mention this because I was very impressed with the speed and efficiency of the customer service. 

As for the Nest itself, I love it. Setup was easy: you connect it to your WiFi network and answer some questions (language, location, etc.) and you're good to go. The app is good and shows you what you need to know. The Nest will "learn" your usual routines and if you are usually gone during a certain time of day, it will reduce the temperature. You are always free to override this if you happen to be home, or just want it warmer or cooler .

What I noticed right away was that my furnace only kicks into the highest fan speed in the morning when the house has to warm up from having been set at a lower temperature all night. During the day, I rarely hear the fan at high speed, unlike with my previous thermostat. 

I also like that you select the temperature just by rotation the outer dial, which is a lot easier and more convenient than hitting little up and down arrows. The temperature shows when you are within range of the thermostat and it's easy to read from a distance. As you approach the Nest, it shows you what the thermostat is set to. 

The display also shows the outdoor temperature and indoor humidity.

I bought mine on sale, and also got a $100 rebate from my utility company since I have both gas and electric from them.
title: Even better than I had hoped

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Dexture1
content:
This thing is great. I wanted one but could never justify the price. 
 I had to get a new thermostat because on January 1st I shocked my touch screen thermostat and fried the screen. It was stuck at 60 degrees and I could only adjust the temp down. Good thing I had gift cards from Christmas. So with that reason I will say that it was the best accident for the new year. I love that you can customize the settings so that at certain times the temp will change or that if your cell phone leaves the house the temp will adjust to a lower level. Once you come back and reconnect to your wifi the temp will go back to what you previously set it to. Installation was a snap. I am not a handyman but installation took me less then 10 mins. Very cut and dry as to what to do. I think the thermostat on this unit is more accurate then my last one. Our house seems to stay warmer. It is kind of cool to go into the reports and you can see all the adjustments that were done. If you have kids that like to mess with it you will definitely see at what time they decided to kick up the heat. I thought about the eco version but I didn't like how it looked. Is that vanity speaking? Possible but if you are going to be staring at the temp all the time you should get something that is eye pleasing.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: SmartDad88
content:
We purchased this when it was on super sale through the holidays last year(2017) which was almost, if not half, the retail price. 

Google/Nest does a great job with this kind of price reduction on all their products. 

The bonus was we received a credit from our energy company for the thermostat as well, making it almost free.

The previous bills without this thermostat were 25-50$ a month higher the previous years during winter and summer peak energy usage. Which in total was about 4-6 months of the year. Even if we had paid full price for this unit it would have paid for itself within the first two years.

The learning it does during the different times of day makes it a breeze to almost never have to touch the thermostat. 

The home/away sensing is awesome too. 

The only issue we have had isn't really the thermostats fault. It's location is in a hallway which is in the middle of the house. Our 60's Ranch house is very compartmentalized which means if you have all hallway doors closed it can throw off the temps in the other rooms(colder/hotter dependant on time of year exterior temps) as the hallway is generally the longest regulated temp in the house as it doesn't have a HVAC register. 

 This is leading us to believing we may need to purchase the Nest Temp Sensor(s) to rectify this issue. Not everyone will have this problem it really depends on house layout and insulation properties of your exterior walls and ceiling/roof. Which is why I don't knock the thermostat down a star.

Ultimately it does everything it's built for while saving you money.
title: Savings starts year one.

author: VictorYao
content:
Pros:
1. Easy to install (don't follow the schematics in the paper instruction. Use the NEST website for the correct wiring.

3. App on iphone works with no issue. Like the Usage history and why energy consumption is high on that day.
4. Auto away mode works. It has a motion sensor that turns on the display when you walk by.

Areas of improvement:
1. Heater/air-con only turns on 2-3 degrees above/below set points. Have to manually compensate when setting my range.
2. Paper instruction wiring is misleading especially on RC or C wires. Use the website to get your correct wiring.
3. Expensive toy

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: CajunDad7
content: I purchased two Nest Thermostats and a sensor. I liked what I purchased so much, I bought 3 more sensors. The sensors are essentially electronic thermometers that you can put at places distinct from the thermostat. In our house the thermostats are in the hallway and they always over heat and over cool the bedrooms. Thus I can use a sensor in the room as the thermometer and thus the set point for heating and cooling. The installation was easy. I did it myself. I have a good working knowledge of this sort of work, but it is easy and the instructions are straight forward. There are numerous videos available to help with installation. It appears through the first month that we have saved some money, but I will have to look over the year and base it on the average costs of heating and cooling. But based on the usage that the Nest evaluates, we have used less than last year and the temperature seems most even to that observed the previous year. Nevertheless, a more thorough evaluation is needed. The nest has great features including energy saving features, easy of use, voice control of heating and cooling temperatures (if you use the right app), etc. I am very happy with my purchase.
title: Nest Thermostats have been great so far

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: SWhitlock
content: I bought this in a bundle package, and was not disappointed. The display is nice, and it is super easy to setup. Using the Nest website's tutorial videos, I was able to swap this out from my old thermostat, and get it programmed in under 10 minutes. The thermostat learns my family's routines, and over time makes adjustments based on what it learns. The display is customize-able with different information. It is very easy to adjust the temperature or switch from heating to cooling. Using the Nest App, you can customize schedules on your own, and there are even "eco" settings, where you can let the thermostat run to a temperature to save you money on your utility bills. I also bought 2 of the optional Nest temperature sensors (because I have a 3-story house). The only downfall to those that I didn't know about is the system can only run, based on which sensor you choose (in my case, I can make it heat my house based on the thermostat on the main floor, or one of the sensors in the basement or on the 2nd floor. But not all 3). I can also control my thermostat/temperatures from my Google Home speakers or displays; along with the app. And, with the Google Home Assistant, you can set up "routines" in there. So when you leave the house, you can make a routine and say something like "I'm leaving", and it would turn down the temperature to an Eco setting.
title: Great product, and easy to set up.

author: RandomPerson8

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Bandino
content: Installation was made super-easy with video and included tools (although it seemed wasteful to include a tool in each package for people like me who bought multiple units but only needed one tool). Set up was also easy, and the Nests look fantastic and work ok overall (more on where they fall short below). Small issue is the app (for remote control) could be more intuitive. Larger issue is that when I set all thermostats to "Away" (with a single tap in the app, which is great) they do not stay set to away for some reason... in four days of being away on vacation, I've gone into the app six time to confirm that the thermostats were still set to Away, and four times they were back on their regular schedule heating the house. So I had to again manually set to Away 4 times. Not only is this gitch annoying (because part of the proposition of having these is peace of mind, not having to think about them or do things manually) but they are not saving me money if they're running the heat to the same temps as if we were home. My old programmable were a pain to manually set when we were going on vacation (and then to reset to regular programs when we got home) but at least they worked properly. Nests are cool, but so far they have not been as set-it-and-forget-it as I was led to believe.
title: Wish They Worked as Great as They Look

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: DanW
content:
I bought this, to replace our old programmable thermostat, and I'm glad I made the change. The programmable thermostat was cumbersome to change the programming, and not very responsive to touches. With the Nest thermostat, the navigation is much easier, and intuitive. I can also pull out my phone, and easily make adjustments, even if I'm not at home.

Some of the additional features I like: 
- It also has the ability to learn your habits, and eventually, it will create it's own schedule (if you allow it, in the settings)
- It has a proximity sensor, so the screen goes dark, when you aren't near, but as you approach, it changes the amount of details, displayed
- You can set it to display other items, instead of the current temp. For instance, we have it set to show the current temp outside, which also shows the weather predictions, for the rest of the day, as you get closer

Installation was just as easy as any other thermostat. If anything, it was a little easier, since it uses spring loaded terminals, rather than wrapping the wires around a screw.

My only complaint is that I would like the screen to be touch controlled, rather than dial the outer ring to an option, then 'click' the front face, by pushing it in. Not a big deal though, since I have all the same options, through the app on my phone.
title: Love having intelligence behind my thermostat

Depending on which model and color you get, it sometimes reminds me of a door nob on the wall.  Since you will control the device from the app, you normally would never walk up to the wall unit and do any adjustment.  I like that it is Alexa friendly but the voice control can be tricky.  I would recommend this or Honeywell.  I think it depends on user preference.

author: Alexcon42
content:
I had a Honeywell connected thermostat that just kept losing wireless connection and after a year it decided it did not want to cool my system anymore, so i decided i wanted to upgrade to the nest.
On opening the box just the way it was packed you know you have a quality item and has nice weight to the device also
The instruction on how to install was quite good and easy to follow, the only issue was the sticky labels were not tooo good and kept slipping of so be careful, i took a picture after i labeled just in case.
the nest has a plastic surface that is 3/4 covering the glass that you might think needs to be peeled off but is actually part of the device surface , i checked online and is teh only way i found out not to touch it. once installed going through the menu, off course you need wireless connection and to download the app, but you can do this without as i connected after the unit was setup and installed. after connection and running it was easy to use from the app, don't forget this is a learning device. there was some lag time between switching the cooling system on and off but after a few days it git better or i just did not notice anymore, overall this is a great device and good value for money for the future.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: TVDB
content:
If you aren't familiar with this thermostat, there are two things you should know: 1) it is a Google product 2) efficiency maximization is part of its design. So, for whatever that's worth to you, now you know! I've been using it for only two weeks, and my main frustration is that I want the house cooler (Texas summer) but it has many times let the dang place warm up at the worst time, late afternoon, when letting up the gas for just twenty minutes can send the temperature climbing fast and can't recover til long after dark. Even though its dialed down. In the mean time I have learned how to turn off those features, but still have to crank it to 50 sometimes when it shows the temp 5+ degrees warmer than where it's set and it has stopped running.

The other thing that it does which is rather impressive, is that it operates the condensor, the exchange, and the blower independently, thus coaxing the system to cool FAR BETTER than a basic on/off thermostat. It can really get this place chilly. And probably at a fraction the energy use. 

So, a mixed review - would be nice if simply did what it was asked, but it is impressive how it can really drive the system, probably saving money in the process.  

I would conditionally recommend it.
title: This is not what I thought it was.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Eastcoaster
content: I was originally going to go with the Ecobee. However, the one I got was defective and there were none left at Best Buy to get another one. So I needed a wifi thermostat so I got the nest. I love the design and it looks very nice. I had actually have it installed in a different area of my home due to the fact that it required 3 wires instead of the two my old one had and due to the age of the home and retaining walls we could not run a third wire. It went well for a few days and then I noticed it always offline via the app. I had stopped renting the modem from Comcast years ago and used my own in addition to wifi. I blamed the nest for never being connected as my other devices were always online. So I ended up just giving the Comcast box a try since I just upgraded. It had wifi in the modem. My nest has never been offline since. If you have connectivity issues check your wifi (clearly the newer systems are much better than the 8yr old one I was dealing with). Talk about simplicity! I turn my thermostat up on my drive home! It's much more efficient than the programming days. If I'm late, I'm not wasting energy. When I'm in bed upstairs, I turn it down before bed/when I wake up. It may sound lazy but you just have far more control. My plumber installed it when I converted to gas from oil. Very user friendly.
title: Not bad

It works well, and it knows when I'm not home so it can save me money when I'm away! What's not to love?

Also, spinning it to set the temp feels premium. I've never felt a premium knob before I spun the nest. Now other knobs feel cheap and I can't stand spinning them.

author: ThermaNest
content:
I would recommend this product to anyone that is thinking about switching out there older thermostats for a much smarter thermostat. After I finally got the Nest installed, I have not in any shape or form, regretted it.

I will say that the instruction manual is very informational, except for a very small fact. If you do not have AC, do not hook up the White wire, because it will send an error code to the thermostat, and it will not work properly.

If you have any issues at all, contact and ask for tech support from Nest, because the gentleman I spoke to new my HVAC system like the back of his hand.

One other small note. Try not to cut back all of your wiring because you may need some extra wire that can break off and you won't have it. Even though I did this, the technician told me what to do to resolve that issue and it was absolutely simple.

It's nice to be able to turn on your fan, air conditioning, or the heat from the convenience of your phone.
title: Beginner Nestor

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: DrBob
content:
The 3rd Generation Nest Learning Thermostat is an excellent investment in smart home technology as an energy and money saver. It is extremely easy to install using the detailed instructions included in the package or any of the dozens of Youtube videos to be found online. Once installed, it virtually programs itself to adjust the heating and cooling parameters to the activity patterns within your home space. At the same time, it provides ample opportunities to override these self-determined settings to suit the immediate or long-term situation. Many energy providers are sponsoring rebate programs that can somewhat offset the (admittedly high) initial cost of the Nest device.
I have used it so far for a little more than three weeks in a fluctuating temperature spell and have found it highly correlated (through its detailed history function available in the smartphone app) with the number of degree days. More importantly, the house is always comfortable within the temperature ranges I have specified. A test of the cooling functions will have to wait several months I fear but I have no doubt it will prove equally helpful.
title: An excellent smart thermostat

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: HarryO
content: We purchased the Nest - Learning Thermostat, on sale. I opened the box, and followed the installation instructions. Make sure you take a picture of your existing thermostat's wire connections and label each wire (using the labels included by Nest) before you disconnect anything. Once you have done this, the rest is pretty easy. Don't forget to download the Nest app to your smartphone, and set-up a Nest account. Also, apply for any rebates you may be qualified for (ex. So Cal Edison and/or So Cal Gas - up to $125!). I recommend that you also sign up for So Cal Edison's Rush Hour program (additional credits to your bill). We've had the Nest Thermostat for a week now, and our central heat and air runs in the morning (5am) for a few minutes to heat the house to 72F. The house stays above 70F the rest of the day. The Nest already learned our routine, and it "knows" when we leave the house with our smartphones and automatically sets the thermostat to Eco mode. I think this was a smart purchase for our home. We had new insulation added to the attic, walls, and under the floors in 2015 so we don't leak much warm air and the furnace doesn't run very often.
title: Nest - Learning Thermostat is pretty cool!

Very happy with this product

author: Doreenm
content: Wiring the device is as easy is going to the Nest website telling it which wires you have in your existing thermostat, it will then show you a diagram of how to connect the new thermostat and stickers you can wrap around your wires in case there are different colours. The only thing the instruction manual did not mention is there is a USB port on the back of the thermostat that you can use to charge a little it before you install it. My thermostat shut down during the installation process because the battery was low. I would recommend charging the device a little using a micro USB cable before installation. This has so far been the easiest thermostat to set up. Connection to the Nest app was easy. I would definitely recommend this product.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Georgie
content:
The thermostat was easy to install. All you have to do is look at the present wiring and follow the online instructions to see if it will work with your wiring. Then, there are step-by-step instructions for installation. My system was over 30 years old, but it installed without difficulty. All the parts necessary are there with the thermostat.

I know there are other thermostats out there, but the Nest Learning gets great reviews. Also, reviews stated that some of the other ones had hangups on installation with older systems.

The thermostat and APP are very intuitive. I have had no problems controlling my system from afar If necessary. I am looking forward to a much lower heating and air-conditioning bills.
title: Easy Installation

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: dbfirefighter
content:
I have not seen a heating bill yet but I think we will see a savings. What we like is after the first week it learned our routine and automatically adjusts the temperature before we get home, at night and away for the day. What is even better is both my wife and I have it on our phones (Apple & Android) and we adjust it if our routine changes like turning it on before we get home early or tell it when we are away.

We have to travel over the weekends for kids sports and it is no longer a worry when we are driving down the road to see if someone remembered to turn down the heat. My wife is not a techie (I am) but she loves the Nest for the simple usage on her phone.

Another trick I learned is when I feel a little cold in the house and the heater is not running, I figure it is just a cold spot so from my computer or phone, I run the fan for 15 minutes and it circulates the air allowing the temperature to equalize (especially in the hallway where our thermostat is) and the heater to go on if needed.

The last thing I want to mention is customer service. The wiring was not correct and they stay on the phone with you until it is correct. Follow the instructions to take a picture before you disconnect the old one. When our heater broke (circuit board) they never once blamed the heater, they kept working with us to diagnose the issue even putting on an advanced technician until he could absolutely say it was not the thermostat. The only issue was it took about 3 hours between hold times and getting the advanced tech to diagnose.
title: We love it.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: MVSM
content: Purchased two of these for my home - though they are pricey it helped my utility provider had a rebate going for each device (installed and registered). I placed the order after ensuring my existing thermostat connection is compatible with NEST (NEST website has clear instructions on its site to check compatibility). The installation itself was a breeze, and being a novice, it took me 30 minutes to install each device. The setup instructions can be done on the device or through the app, and once connected to your home wifi, the device gets registered automatically with NEST. I found the setup very intuitive, and had both the devices functioning within the hour. It has been a couple of months since I bought them - I love the self-learning feature - it sends you alerts on filter change due, and learns and adjusts based on usage etc. It recently sent an alert on my phone that my furnace needs to be checked as it switches on and off frequently - Love that! I am glad I invested my money in the NEST thermostat.
title: Amazingly simple to install and intuitive function

author: Roadrunner
content:
After 4 weeks, our family is thrilled with this Nest Thermostat purchase. We had a programmable thermostat but it was too hard to configure. After one week of using Nest, it learned our main habits and adjusts the temperature accordingly. When we want to fine tune the temperature, we don't have to walk across the house to do it -- we just pick up our phone from our nightstand! Moreover, it was super easy to install. It was up and running in 10 minutes, including the time it took to take it out of the box. 

I definitely recommend going online to Nest website first to test compatibility and to obtain a wiring diagram. Makes the install way easier.
title: Smarter than me thermostat

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: AGKorson
content:
So easy to install. The instructions will walk you through the steps so you really can't make a mistake. 
It looks fantastic on the wall, the main display is high resolution so it is easy to read onscreen text. 
And operation is just as easy; i was amazed at how quickly it picked up our weekly and daily patterns. After a couple weeks, we hardly touch the thermostat at all. 
I like that it can be controlled remotely, and that it also links to other home control applications. Although I don't use the feature very often, it is nice to know it's there if needed.
It's too early to tell for sure if our utility bills will go down or up, but it appears to be slightly lower so far. Even if there's not a significant cost savings, the control features make this well worth the price.
title: Amazingly Easy, Amazing Performance

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: lancyqusa
content:
I took advantage of a price drop during the Thanksgiving holidays. I couldn't have been happier on the pricing front!
I also purchased the Geek Squad install, unfortunately, the technician that came out couldn't figure out 2 wires that were connected to my old Lennox Signaturestat thermostat, so, he just abandoned the install and cancelled the service. So, it was left to me to perform the install, I found out that the two wires on my old thermostat was the outdoor temperature sensor which was no longer needed with the Nest.
The install process was straight forward, I took pictures of the old wiring, matched the wires, and connected to the Nest terminals. I tested the thermostat after the install and everything looked good!
One tip that may help some of you is to ensure that the wires don't pop out too much to a point that they push the thermostat outwards,
title: Great thermostat! Highly recommended!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: DaveJ
content: I have 2 of the 3rd generation Nest thermostats which I purchased from Best Buy as I am Elite Plus member and Best Buy had a great $50 gift card rebate on each as well making the purchase a great deal. I was able to replace my upstairs and downstair thermostats in literally 5-10 minutes each, no need to call for technical support at any time. As for the product, it took about a week for each unit to "learn" our regular patterns and adjust to times we are not home and it has a sensor which detects motion to verify if we are at home. Additionally, it was very easy to connect to the internet, set-up, and set my schedules. Another great feature is the App on my Apple Smart phone, I can manually control the units from anywhere, anytime... As an example, we were away all day and I awoke the Nest thermostats from their away mode about 30 minutes before I arrived back home, our house was at a great temperature when we arrived without having to wait for it to warm up after we got back. Basically, it saves so much energy incorporating the Away feature it will pay for itself faster then I expected...
title: Excellant Thermostat

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: ngnichols
content: I decided to buy this after also switching power providers to a significantly lower cost per kilowatt hour. I wanted to really cut down on my electricity bill and I figured this would also be a good measure. The existing thermostat I had was not a programmable model and didn't seem like it was very accurate either. I wasn't sure how hot it actually got in my place and so I left my thermostat on 85 thinking it wouldn't hit that high during the day, but it would. Given that, I would be cooling my place for no reason at all and wasting money. This allows me to set the exact time it shuts off and comes on so I can save energy while away at work or wherever else and also always make sure I come home to a properly cooled house without wasting money. Highly recommend to anyone looking to cut costs and get more efficient with their cooling/heating. Install is simple and self explanitory and comes with tools to do it. App works great on the iPhone and senses when you are away from home.
title: Easy to install and easy to use

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Cenuticket
content:
We were looking at the item on display, and of course there were no sales people to be found, and a total stranger asked us if we were interested in the NEST. Our NEST thermostat is installed and does what it says we can do. We are also going to purchase the smoke alarm and camera.

My thermostat was sticking so thought I would buy one of these to replace it.  I love the looks and the wifi hook-up.  I found the 'learning' function annoying as it kept changing the temp against what I wanted.  It really can't read my mind.  

The learning thing has no easy turn off so I googled it and followed someone's youtube video that showed how to turn off the learning feature.  (basically clear everything out and start over w/o any history and it stays off).

It is pricey if you don't use the learning feature but I think it is way cooler looking than my Honeywell rectangle.  I bought another one for my other floor.  Would recommend.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: jeffavl
content: I love the Nest Thermostat...it was easy, easy to install and set up. Even comes with a cute little screwdriver and built in level. Connecting was just as easy...everything went without a hitch on the first try. Just beautiful and I love that it detects when you are present. I found myself just walking by it to watch it light up. HOWEVER, I did have a moment of pause this week when I realized that there was a software glitch that left a lot of people out in the cold...literally. And the reason that I wanted the Nest in the first place is because I split my time between two places that are 5K miles apart...and I found out about the glitch from Alaska...but by the time I found out about it and tried to log on, it was resolved...so no harm this time. I do love being able to check in on my house from afar and see that all is well. So, yes it is awesome and it works incredible...just bear in mind that it does require a wifi connection to work, and if something happens to that connection you are powerless. I would still buy it knowing all of this...it adds a lot of modern flair to your house.
title: An aesthetic dream

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: ChattanoogaTN
content:
The Nest thermostats are fantastic. I have a lot of Nest products in my home (including the cameras) and have been very satisfied. The ability to remotely connect and monitor usage and change the temperature is great. The integrations with Google Home and IFTTT are icing on the cake.

I give it 4 instead of 5 stars for two reasons:
1) The learning part of this "learning" thermostat is next to useless. Several of my friends also have this thermostat and everyone has complained about how poorly it learns schedules for your comfort. You'll need to go into the app and set your own temperature schedules.
2) The thermostat requires more power to run than some setups will provide -- even setups where the thermostat is otherwise perfectly functional. Some HVAC units only power while the unit is running, which means the Nest will first shut off WiFi and then eventually go to sleep. I understand the need for constant power, but my annoyance is that the solution is not found anywhere in the Nest support documentation. I ended up finding a thread on a 3rd-party site where someone explained connecting the Common wire to supply proper power. Why couldn't Nest explain that?
title: Great, if you set your own schedule

I figured installation would be a complicated ordeal, but I couldn't have been more wrong. It took about 15 minutes to install and another 15 minutes to set up. I'm amazed at how useful these "little computers" are and how they've helped lower my utility usage in such a short time. It "learns" your preferences and senses when you're "away" from home, then adjusts the temperature accordingly. There's no setting up a daily "schedule", because it "learns" how you like the temperature over time. The phone app (and web log-in) allows me to monitor and control from anywhere in the world. This is a great product! I shouldn't have waited.

author: jimh
content: When 1st installed the nest Thermostat the temperature reading was 3-4 degrees off from every other thermostat/thermometer I had. I called Nest for assistance. The initial tech verified all the wiring was correct then referred me to tier 2. This tech verified all the settings in the thermostat and when he found nothing wrong there suggested we reset the thermostat and start over from scratch. Once we performed the reset and reprogrammed it the thermostat started reading within 1/2 degree of the thermometer I had hanging on wall next to the Nest. Both Technicians were very professional and helpful. The thermostat has been working flawlessly since. I love the way it learns the temperatures we want during the day and adjusts temp when we are gone for long periods of time

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: etchlings
content:
This is a fantastic thermostat. The setup and installation are absurdly simple, and comprehensively documented. Even with one small difference in my setup from standard, the online documentation had a solution and I was directed there by the device itself during install. What thoughtful design that is.

As for its "intelligent functionality", the Away feature took about a week to learn my habits and the device does a better job than my old unit (programmable) did at keeping things at the temperature it says it is holding. Haven't had a chance to fully rely on the A/C yet, as it's winter, but the heater and fan have been without issue. The A/C was tested and worked during install, however.

We really adore the way it "greets" you as you walk by, too. It's non-intrusive, silent, and helpful to see the current status of the system at a glance.
title: Does everything it promises

author: Vinodk
content:
I bought this via the Black Friday deal and so far I'm loving it.
I love not having to program it or to remember to drop the temperature when going out for anextended time. Plus I can see how much heat I used and for how long and also when the heat came on. I'm planning to get another for 2nd zone and eventually a 3rd.

I've had one issue a few days ago where the display no longer lit up when walking past it. Upon investigating, I noticed the wifi was disconnected and it said low battery. I called tech support and they couldn't understand why since the power readings were on par. They advised to reset the network settings and leave it to see if it would recharge. I did this and it took 24hrs to charge.
Hoping this doesn't re occur.
It didn't impact hearing which was good. I just had no control over it via the app.
title: Great thermostat. Cool features.

author: CurvedTVuser
content: Was looking for a thermostat that has remote access from a wireless device. This Nest thermostat is amazing, easy to install and setup is a breeze. Above all it looks great "high tech" on the wall as well. Since this generation has also far-sight, it shows the room temperature when "far" from the thermostat or when close by it shows the temperature where it is going to (as adjusted) including the amount of time it would take. It is also a self learning thermostat that keeps track of when someone is at home or not and adjust the temperature accordingly (that needs to be pre-setup). This thermostat also communicates with other Nest products such as Nest Protect (smoke/CO2 detector) as well the Nest-cam. Overall I would say, if you want to convert to a "smart home" it starts with this thermostat. It is worth the investment.
title: Nice necessary gadget.

author: Ellett
content:
I've had a Next 2nd generation for a couple of years and it's worked so well that I got a Nest for my son's house. Now I can monitor and manage both houses.

Economical - it learns your habits and uses the knowledge to reduce energy consumption when you're not home or when you're sleeping.
Convenient - the furnace or A/C can fire up when you're a few minutes away from home so the house is comfortable by the time you walk in the door.
And it works with Google Home or Amazon Echo so you can start the heat just as you're getting ready to shower, and then dial it back when you're dressed, all with voice commands.
title: Convenience AND economy

Installation was fairly simple, it took longer to find the right fuse for the thermostat than it did to actually install it. Love that I can change the thermostat from my phone, but even better, within 2 weeks it had programmed itself to our everyday habits, so eco mode while away, and the house is comfortable by the time we get home. I definitely recommend the Nest system, its amazing, all in one app.

author: BobM

They both also communicate with my two Nest Protect smoke/carbon monoxide units for added security. This is money well worth spent. As an additional bonus, if you have them installed by a Nest Pro, the warranty gets extended for an additional three years.

Also integrates well with my amazon echo, so I can just ask Alexa to set the temperature to whatever I want.

Easy to install. Very user friendly everything about

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: SpencerMearsAudioVideo
content: What a great way to control the HVAC in your home. I love that it learns my habits for what temperatures I like and that I can pull up the app and view when the heat/cool has been running. NEST has done a wonderful job and I was extremely impressed with the thought put into what was included with the thermostat. Not only did it have the standard things like the thermostat, installation instructions and mounting equipment, but it also had a level, screw driver and a cover plate to cover where my old thermostat had been painted around. I would highly recommend this thermostat to anyone.
title: Nest Thermostat

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Teder
content:
There is little reason NOT to install this thermostat. There was a pretty decent sale and our local utility company also has a rebate for the installation of it. Sweet.
It does begin to "learn" our habits after about a week. It's great to wake up to a warmer house and have it cooler at night while sleeping. Like the idea of monitoring from basically wherever we are to ensure that the heat is on....and if it isn't, can alert a friend/neighbor to have it checked.
Works with Alexa as well.
title: Glad We Did It

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Venki
content: I was first hesitant to buy this. But reading lot of reviews finally bought this on a Black friday. Nest is what our home needed. The electric box plate came in handy, and the included mounting plate looks so nice on our wall, we may not even paint it. The setup was easy, I linked it with our WiFi and then downloaded the app on my phone. After syncing my phone with the thermostat, I can adjust the house temperature from anywhere! The Controls are so simple. I highly recommend buying this.
title: Easy to Install and a Great Product

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: familykitchen
content: My brother set up the Nest. We think he made it look easy to install. No more than 20 min. We downloaded the app on our mobile device and boom! We were creating a schedule. We haven't had a glitch at all. Keeping it cooler at night and when nobody is home in the daytime. Nobody seems to have noticed when it changes the temperature. Very smooth. I am hoping this will help save money by having a schedule. Now I don't have to worry if I remembered to lower the temperature when I leave for work. But I can also keep the temperature higher when the kids are home. Easy to operate with a smart phone.
title: Great for watching your budget

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Medic502
content:
I have been considering getting a Nest Thermostat for serval months now after reading reviews and how the product can save you money.

I opened the package and the install couldn't have gone more smoothly. Everything I needed for my application was present and it frankly took longer to uninstall my previous one than it did to install my Nest.

The physical set up of the product in terms of software was a breeze. Easy to set up the mobile application as well.

I can tell already how much more efficiently my furnace is running. The thermostat was quick to learn my and my wife's habits and adjust to them. It keeps my fan running only when needed and gets the house nice and warm before bed.
title: Easy Install, Great Product

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Dablmc
content: Talk about convenience, away from home for the day and plans change, connect to the thermostat with my smartphone with either the auto away feature or just tell it to set to Away, coming home sooner than expected, that's covered too with my smartphone. Staying up later than usual and feeling a little chilly, talk to Amazon Echo and say "Alexa, Nest 72" and watch the NEST light up and go to work. Over time I see adding Nest Protect and cameras. I love that I can see my usage on my phone or computer. Installing the NEST was so easy and there are plenty of videos and help available, if needed, on the NEST website.
title: Love my NEST Learning Thermostat 3rd Gen

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: JJJJ
content: Nest made a boring utilitarian device into a must have 21st Century gadget. Love how it learns your schedule and it tracks your usage. So cool and sleek. product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White

author: Filly801
content: We did a bit of research on this thermostat before making the purchasing. At first it seemed similar to programmable thermostats that are much less in initial cost, but it's far superior. The Nest thermostat not only learns your schedule and changes temperatures accordingly, but lets you know when you're being energy efficient. Seeing the leaf (Nest's way of telling you you're being energy more efficient) has helped us become more aware of our energy usage, which in turn has saved us money. In the long run, this product will easily pay for itself. In addition, the ability to change the house temperature while away has been a great added benefit!
title: Great product! Saves $$

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Bestbuyguy
content: I have two of these units at my house and was asked by my boss to put one in our office. These units are very easy to install and connect to an app in order to be able to control it remotely. The best feature is the Home/Away assist feature which will change the target temperature automatically when you are away. I hear that Nest is also coming out with individual room sensors which will allow you to balance temperatures between rooms. This will be a nice addition.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: GBSJG
content: Our bills have come down considerably since getting this. We adjust it all the time from around the house, when we are out etc. Our Electric company says we are 22% more efficient than our neighbors! With pets in the home, its so nice to be able to check on the temperature in the house to make sure they are comfortable. This has made such a difference. During a recent heatwave, we were abroad and realized the house was particularly hot (no-one (4 legs included) was in the house, but we worried about electrical equipment) and from 4500 miles was able to remotely control our home temps. Amazing!.
title: Actually life changing!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: DPilcher
content: Purchased this unit before Christmas and had it installed and set up in 20 minutes (including painting wall where old square unit was). Once connected to the network, it automatically went out and checked for an update before setting it up. Really enjoy the phone app and being able to see what utility usage has been. Setting a schedule can be done by it learning your expectations or by going into the app and setting it yourself. It really does track your movement within the home and found I needed to adjust the schedule as the Holiday comings and goings are different than other times of the year. Great product and have had no issues with our unit thus far.
title: So much easier than other's of similar product

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: krism71
content: The first thing I would like to say is that the install instructions are amazingly simple. I have never wired a thermostat, and the in-box instructions got me about 95% the way there to do it myself, so I was very satisified with install. In terms of competency and features, this thermostat is fantastic. The ability adjust the temperature from anywhere is very convenient for travelers, in addition the device learns your habits and adjusts accordingly. To maximize the benefits of this device, pair it with google home, so that you can adjust the temperature with your voice!
title: Awesome Device

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: thadn
content:
Really like my Nest gen 3 thermostat. Installation was fairly straight forward. Make sure you use the online wiring guide. It creates a custom picture to follow based on the wires you currently use.

Having the ability to control the temperature from the upstairs bedroom is really convenient. I know a lot of wifi thermostats can do that, but the additional features of the Nest make it stand out. I especially like the balance choices for using the heat pump vs aux heat.
title: excellent product

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: jasvanek
content:
Most people are interested in the Nest Thermostat when you discuss features. Which there are a lot of. But there is a hesitation when they see the price. Understandable.

After two months I do have to say it is worth the investment. Living in Oklahoma I set it in Heat/Cool mode and haven't touched it since. I set the upper and lower temps and it handles it. Does a better than fair job keeping my house comfortable without my intervention. It knows when I'm home and when I'm away. And to be honest, I'm really impressed when how well the 'learning' part of this thermostat works.

Why only four stars? Let's be honest, price. For most of us $250 is a lot to spend for a thermostat. Even if it does do some very smart things. Would I purchase another one in the future? Probably. Would I replace my current one with the next new version? Probably not. It would have to be pretty compelling new features to do that. For right now it seems to do a good job managing the climate of my home.
title: Spendy, but worth the investment

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: mattbl
content: I loved the older thermostats, and this is even better. Bigger display and better features. I love the separate temperature sensors that I can put in different rooms and make the temp in those rooms the target setting at different times on the day. I wish it was fully customized instead of just morning, day, evening and night, but it's definitely a major improvement!
title: Great Thermostat, I replaced the 2nd generation

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Bruce
content: Enjoy our new Nest system. We wave a two story home with separate up & down stairs thermostats. We installed tw nest thermostats. Setup was easy and the nest system learned our daily schedule. Manually setting away / home mode from our iPhone / iPad is easy. Temp adjustments are quick. One screen on our iPhones showing an overview of both is helpful. Detail screens showing usage info was eye opening. I am planning on expanding the system with other "works with nest" and IFTTT products for an overall home energy efficient (lower utility bill) system.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Tooth
content: This thermostat is so easy to install yourself. Programs on it's own, step by step process is a breeze. I had to call Verizon Fios to have them remove a firewall authentication setting to my wifi to connect it, so that was the hardest part. Then it's connected and everything is so easy. Thing I like the most is being able to manage the temperature from any distance. I can warm up or cool down the apartment on my way home. And then it learns your daily routine and follows suit, no need to program it.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Roddy
content: Much easier to install than I expected, took less than 40 minutes including unboxing, reading instructions, mounting, wiring and setting up. Works great, very easy to see set and actual temperatures. But for us the key is the ability to monitor the temperature when we are not at home.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Paintcheckref
content: If you want to save money on your heating and cooling bill, this is it. I took the advise from my son who has one and said it works really well, easy to set up and install. There is always the option to have a technician come in and do it for you if you are not will to try it yourself. But I did it with an older system which was fine. Since he has a newer system it (nest) did all the wiring detection and was a snap to set up and install. One it was in I down loaded the app and it was easy to save on the bill. Auto away function is great and it is truly a learning remote.
title: This is an awesome product

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: ChristianJacob

author: Nellz

I think my favorite feature is that I can change the temp in my house or just run the fans on nights when our bedroom gets extremely warm, without getting out of bed. This allows me to go back to sleep faster and have better nights sleep overall.

author: Trisha

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: WestSider
content:
The Nest is an easy home automation starting point. Installation is easy - it's more or less "unplug old thermostat, reattach wires" (and is guided for the multiple wiring schemes people may have). It then becomes one of the best designed thermostats (admittedly a low bar).

Chief benefits: easier scheduling of heat/cold; "learning" of schedules; plug-in into energy companies' power saving plans (surge schedules) which can provide monetary benefits.

The Nest is not perfect - the user interface strips down interactions to "click" or "dial left/right" (it could really use a "back out" button ala the Home button), but it's leagues beyond what most people have slapped onto their walls.
title: User-friendly thermostat with cost-saving benefits
