product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: HasaraD
content: Does everything it says. Be sure to hook up the common wire when you install it or run a common wire from your furnace if you don't have one already. The Nest powers itself via the Y-R wires to charge it's internal battery. If you don't run your furnace very often, the internal battery will run down, and the furnace won't run until you put a charge in the Nest via microusb. Using the common wire (blue) will provide steady 20v to the unit and thus keep the charge. Other than that, it's a solid thermostat. I like the daily usage summary. It HAS helped to keep costs down. I've probably saved 30% by scheduling and letting Nest learn our routine. Installation is straightforward and well documented. Just be sure to use the blue common wire and run one if you don't have one already.
title: Hook up the Common Wire!

Getting it up and running on my iPhone app was simple and the installation was super easy, too. The hardest part was just repairing my wall because I didn't want to use the square faceplate that came with the unit.

My only complaint is that I thought it would work with Apple's Home app, and thus far, I've not been able to make that happen. That's the only reason for 4 stars instead of 5. If I would have known this, I probably would have purchased a different unit, but that has more to do with how I want to run my house than it does the thermostat itself. 

All in all, it is an awesome unit and unless you're trying to do a whole home integration using Apple Home, then I highly recommend it.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: BMWAndroid
content: I first purchased an Ecobee 3 and after setting a weekly schedule it did a superb job and also worked really well using Siri via Apple HomeKit but since I prefer Android and it didn't integrate with Google Now, I though I would give the Nest a try instead. The build quality of the Nest feels superior since it is heavy and has some heft to it but the user experience is awful. I thought that using the dial for adjusting temperates was more convenient, but that is about all it has going for it, and besides isn't the point to not have to constantly adjust it? More on that later. Using the dial as the only way to navigate the interface is annoying and slow compared to the Ecobee3's touchscreen. To get into the menu section on the Nest you have to press down on the dial and hold it. Once there, you have to navigate everything via the dial and pressing down, very similar to something like BMW's iDrive control knob. Unfortunately it takes way too long to navigate when all you want to do is change a few things. This would perhaps not be so much of a problem if you didn't have to constantly adjust it. Learning? What learning? It's heating all the time when I don't want it to or when I am not home, and then not heating when I am freezing. And yes, it is installed correctly, just in case you were wondering. I even reset it to start the learning process from scratch and still it doesn't seem to every figure out my habits. I did not set up a schedule and one could blame me for that, but honestly the whole device is marketed as being so smart that you shouldn't ever have to manual program a weekly schedule. I have a very regular work schedule as well, so it should have figured out most of my habits after weeks of giving it a shot. As for Google Now integration, it is useless. You give your phone Google Now commands and it rarely ever reaches the Nest. Perhaps that's a problem on Google's side and not the Nest's fault, but it is the same issue with different Android devices. Ultimately though it means that I like very little about this product. I was interested in installing the custom firmware to the Nest which allows you to connect directly to the thermostat via your wifi network without having to have a cloud service as a middle-man, but seeing as though I so strongly prefer having a larger informative touchscreen to the physical knob and a tiny screen that only shows you the temperature when you walk by, I don't really want to keep it. It looks elegant and feels nice to the touch, but the technology is inferior and feels outdated.
title: Build quality nice but inferior product

author: RickM
content:

The thermostat and phone application setup went without issue. If you are going to hook this up to your wireless network, make sure you know the security key so it can make the connection. So far I'm pleased with the purchase. Can't wait to see if I can actually measure the benefits that are claimed. I guess time will tell.

author: neuronerd

Other minor grievance would be fan controls; the fan can only be set in hour increments and can't be pre-programmed, but that's just an interest in generating some white noise (and there are other ways to accomplish that).

author: c3vette4spd
content:
I followed the instructions to the letter. It absolutely would not come on. I unhooked it and reinstalled my old thermostat to make sure the issue wasn't on my end. Furnace came back to life with the old thermostat. I went to google for troubleshooting. One post I found said to use a USB cable and plug it into the back of the unit. It came on immediately. Then I unplugged it and reinstall it for the second time and all is well. 
The iPhone app is very good. I can control the temp from anywhere and it tells me how long it's been on and what the temp is inside and out. All things considered, I'd buy it again.

author: CLFNole

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: TexasBarb
content: My brother-in-law bought a Nest thermostat for their new house and raved about it! My husband and I read the reviews and were impressed with what other users had to say. author: djhtechdad
content: We use 2 of these to control both floors of the house. It works well with Alexa and is easily programed both through the app and the device. They look great and every visitor comments on how cool these look. Install wasn't as straightforward as I thought even with connecting to new A/C's, the wiring didn't match up with the directions and/or website tutorial. Although a quick call to customer support resolved my issue quickly - take pics of the wiring BEFORE you disconnect the original thermostat. I'm very thankful I did as it made the support call effortless to get the wiring correct.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Jenners
content: One of our favorite features of this is that we can set it to keep the house within a range of temperatures which helps us to keep energy costs low and temperatures comfortable! Love being able to control it from my phone while I am away from home and not have to walk across the home to it if I need to change something while I am at home.

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White

So without it, I need to change the input (heat and cool) every season which is kind of a pain. Otherwise the thermostat does not get enough power. Nest has offered to pay for putting in the common wire but it sounds like a huge task to put in and walls and floors may have to be ripped up. So long story short, I have just been making the wire change every season.
title: Makes setting the temp easy except for...

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: FredZ43
content: I have a programmable thermostat, but wanted to upgrade to a smart thermostat. Our HVAC system is a heat pump with forced air electric backup. After purchasing the Nest Learning thermostat, I first went to their website and entered the wire info from our programmable thermostat into their thermostat compatibility chart. There was no match, so I opened a chat session with a Nest tech support person. I sent pictures of our present thermostat wiring, but the tech support person said that she could not help and I should contact one of their listed Nest Support vendors in my area. There are 3 in this area and I sent requests to the 2 closest ones. After a week, I did not get a reply from either. I then saw that Best Buy offered a $99 fee to hook up the thermostat, although I did not know if they would travel the 40 miles to my home. In the end, I decided that it would take a very long time, if ever for me to recover the $99 fee in addition to the $161 cost of the thermostat (with electric company rebate) in savings over my programmable thermostat, so I returned it to Best Buy. Best Buy did refund my purchase price, so thank you for that. If you have a simple HVAC system, this should be easy to install, but if you have anything beyond a simple system you may find that this is not compatible.
title: No help from NEST

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Eric305
content:
This product was supposed to help make my home a "smart" home but purchasing this product was the dumbest thing I could have done.

This product was NOT easy to use, it did NOT work at all. For a " third generation" product , i expected to at least be able to easily navigate through the options, easily make selections or even add a simple zipcode for my location.
Even the customer service rep from NEST , advised to enter all my info ir to navigate the product menus snd options on my phone instead of the actual touch screen on the unit.

I spent an entire day on the phone with multiple customer service reps from NEST.

One of them even blamed the faulty operation due to my brand new air conditioner.

At the end I did save money, i saved about $300 by returning the product!
I would never recommend this product to anyone who wants to save money or have a smart home.
Maybe the "fourth generation" will be better.
title: This product is supposed to make my home smarter..

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: KingofDisruptiveIT
content: Was told by Best Buy and Google this would work great with my new heater/AC and heat pump, the unit did work, it is just after installing it my power consumption went from around 1300kVA to over 5000kVA and bill went from an average of 140 a month to 550 per month.  I called Google support when I received my first power bill and it was so high, they checked all the settings, had me change some things and said it should be good, next month it was even higher, called again, had me change some things and said it should be fine now.  Got my next electrical bill, was the highest ever and most usage ever, called again, pretty disgruntled at this point as this device that was supposed to save energy and money had now costed me over 1200 dollars in electrical bills and insane usage, I spent 6 hours on chat with support after which they concluded it was running auxiliary heat and my heat pump at the same time and that it was not compatible....this after 3 months, obviously I wasn't happy.  I thought ok well how do i return the device, this was the best part, sorry sir you can't return the device, completely ridiculous, I had a documented case going back to the first month, I was told it was compatible over and over and their decision is too bad.  Needless to say, I'm done buying any Nest or Google products period.
title: Worst product ever!

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: cxifra
content:
I read all reviews first before purchasing it, and also took advice from a friend who installed it. I also checked compatibility issues and everything seemed OK. Installation was quick and easy.
I first had issues to connect to my wifi network. I rebooted my router and tried a few other things until I got it connected. However, it soon lost connection due to a low battery level. I tried to change the batteries but you can't: this device has unchangeable built-in batteries that charge from the wiring to your furnace. I rechecked connection, checked with Nest Support, and they gave me no good solution to this. It was a weak technical staff. The only way I found to make it charge was to lower the display luminosity level. As it goes on every time it detects movement in front of it, this weird solution managed to keep it working. I had it installed for a week with no problems. Then I travelled for 2 weeks and checked its functioning thru the phone app and it kept working fine. Until a week ago, my furnace got stuck working with the fan only but no heat, and as I live in Minneapolis, that's no good. I could not make it work again, and I could not even reset it. There was a green light blinking on the front of Nest but no other life signals. I had to uninstall it and bring back the original and reliable thermostat. I found out that many users had similar problems due to a bug in the software update released in Dec/2016. I'll try to resurrect it and try to get update its software, but I will return it if not successful.
It does learn your habits and starts regulating the temp. I like the concept and the possibility to check it on line. But it didn't live up to the promise. I recognize I may have gotten a lemon. I would recommend it, but with caution.
title: It looks promising, but failed to deliver

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Primeco
content: The first week the internal battery died not allowing me to control the thermostat. I did some searching on the nest website for solutions but couldn't find answers so i call support (they say their 24/7 but its very poor at best) I talked to a woman who helped in the initial contact i was given a case number and was told to call back if the symptoms persisted. symptoms persisted and i have tried twice with no answer. Today Saturday i called again and after 30 min someone picked up, then put me on hold for another 30 min then some one got my case number and as of this writing i have not heard for that person i am at 1 hour and 26 minutes still on hold. Don't buy any nest product i am going to return this one. They say they have long Waite times because apparently there are a lot of people with issues similar to mine Dont buy Dont buy save your self a big headach
title: 1st week Battery Died

product: Google - Nest Learning Smart Thermostat - 3rd Generation - White
author: Konstantin
content: I bought the 3rd Generation Nest on Black Friday and I installed it couple of days later. The first two days all was great, it was really impressive. All of a sudden the device started displaying a W2 wiring error and shutting down randomly. We rechecked all the wiring and it just did not work. I took down the device and installed by old $30 thermostat back which worked like a charm! So obviously there was a defect in the wiring panel of the Nest. After spending 40 minutes with Nest support I was asked to install the defective Nest back so that they can troubleshoot it. No way I am doing this and putting my family in the cold again with a device that can possibly damage my 2nd stage heater. I wanted to give a Nest a second chance as defects do happen but my experience with their Customer support just persuaded me not to do so. I am returning the device and will never again consider a Nest product.
title: It just didn't work!
